Title: Senior data-analist
Place: Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Senior Data analyst Amsterdam

Heb jij een passie voor data analyse √©n ben je een pionier?




Ben je klaar om Maandag¬Æ verder te helpen naar een datagedreven toekomst en mee te bouwen aan ons nieuwe data platform in Microsoft Fabric?




Maandag¬Æ is een grote detacheergroep die professionals en opdrachtgevers zo goed en snel mogelijk met elkaar koppelt. Dat maakt dat we beschikken over grote hoeveelheden gevarieerde data. Daarom zijn we op zoek naar een enthousiaste Senior Data Analyst (+5 jaar werkervaring) om ons Data Team te versterken. In deze rol vertaal je informatiebehoefte van de werkvloer naar de dashboards en slimme oplossingen. Daarbij werk je samen met onze Data Engineers en Analisten op het nieuwe Maandag¬Æ Dataplatform in Microsoft Fabric.




Naast dat je volop aan het werk gaat met data, kom je in een klein en dynamisch team terecht. Jonge en gedreven collega‚Äôs die allemaal dezelfde interesse hebben als jij; Data. Je zal onderdeel uitmaken van ons Data Team; een team dat door de korte lijnen binnen Maandag¬Æ ook veel samenwerkt en spart. We zoeken iemand die bevlogen is en mee durft te denken en graag resultaten wil boeken.




Wat ga je doen?

Je werkt samen en deelt kennis met het Data Team.
Je schakelt met gebruikers in de organisatie en haalt hun wensen op.
Je ontwerpt en ontwikkelt Power BI dashboards naar de behoefte van de organisatie.
Je vervult een brugfunctie tussen data en de organisatie binnen Maandag¬Æ. Je bent goed in stakeholdermanagement op management niveau.
Je richt het Maandag¬Æ datalandschap in Microsoft Fabric verder in en onderhoudt het.
Je ontwikkelt ETL-processen en (semantische) modellen om gegevens te verplaatsen en te transformeren.
Je zorgt voor de kwaliteit en consistentie van data en implementeert datakwaliteitscontroles.
Je coacht, begeleidt en laat collega teamleden doorgroeien.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een mooi salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4.413,- en ‚Ç¨ 6.306,- op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;
Groot aanbod van trainingen en cursussen √©n coaching on the job;
Je ontvangt een mooie bonus bij het behalen van het behalen van de doelstellingen van de organisatie;
Flexibel verlof, jij bepaalt wanneer en hoe lang je vrij neemt;
Je krijgt 0,23 cent per km aan reiskosten √≥f de NS Business card wanneer je met het OV gaat;
Financi√´le zekerheid vanaf je pensioengerechtigde leeftijd.




Wie zoeken wij?

Je bent in het bezit van een Bachelor- of Masterdiploma en hebt minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.
Je bent een ster in het ontwerpproces van dashboards en beheerst dashboard design principes.
Je hebt ruime ervaring met het schrijven van SQL queries en het ontwikkelen van Power BI dashboards.
Je hebt ervaring met ETL-processen ontwerpen, beheren en ontwikkelen.
Je bent zelfredzaam en communicatief vaardig, in staat om zelfstandig projecten te initi√´ren en tot een goed resultaat te brengen.
Je bent klantgericht: jouw oplossing past bij de wensen, behoeften en verwachtingen van onze klanten.




Solliciteren!

Herken jij jezelf in dit profiel? En lijkt werken bij Maandag¬Æ je een mooie stap? Solliciteer dan meteen. Wie weet ziet jouw maandag er binnenkort dan net zo tof uit als die van ons.




De contactpersoon voor deze vacature is Niels Sabel, Corporate Recruiter. Mocht je vragen hebben, neem dan contact op door te bellen naar 06-51507780.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Wageningen, Gelderland, Netherlands
Description:
UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR A GLOBAL DATA ANALYST

Salary: 44-68 K gross per year depending on background and experience.

We are accepting applications from candidates of all level of experience: beginners to several years. Please mention any relevant past experience with the below mentioned technologies during studies, project work, previous employment, etc.

Location: Hive, Wageningen (Netherlands).

Local conditions apply

Full-time

The applicant must have the right to work in the Netherlands.

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will first consider candidates based in the Netherlands. If you are based outside of the Netherlands and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but we can only take your application on if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the Netherlands.

About Unilever

With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people ‚Äì we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.

At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don‚Äôt believe in the ‚Äòone size fits all‚Äô approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.

About Nutrition R&d

Nutrition is the largest Business Group (BG) in Unilever with global multibillion-dollar brands such as Knorr and Hellman‚Äôs and many strong regional and local brands. Nutrition BG‚Äôs vision is to be a Force for Good in Foods. Nutrition R&D develops and delivers unmissably superior products and solutions that are Boldly Healthier for People and Planet, rooted in differentiated science and technology. With our global innovation centre Hive, in the heart of the Silicon Valley of Food, in Wageningen, The Netherlands, and our network of R&D teams across the world, we work closely with many internal and external partners to create market-winning innovations. Increasingly, Digital and Data are the currency of how we work in R&D, from discovery through product development and deployment. New developments in AI and Data Science will be the crucial differentiator for us to win.

About Digital & Data Team

The Global Nutrition R&D Digital & Data capability is the central team in Division R&D to enable and lead the digital transformation of our organisation. Our core expertise area and responsibility lie in providing the systems expertise and user solutions to drive data quality in our core ingredient and product specifications. Increasingly, we are also strengthening our capability in data engineering, visualisation, data analytics and data science to extract the maximum value from the data we have and utilize it to support the in-silico design agenda. The capability team is working closely together with many teams across Nutrition R&D, ranging from Regional Deploy Centre/Local Deploy teams on product specifications to Global Design Centre/Science & Technology/Capability teams on data science and models.

Job Purpose

Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do ‚Äì creating a better business and a better world. Within Nutrition R&D, Digital and Data Capability team we are looking for a Global Data Analyst. The key features of this role are to monitor the quality of data we have in our digital systems and utilize that data for creation of user-friendly solutions (e.g. reports, dashboards, tools, apps). These solutions will need to be maintained and evolve over time or will be one-off bespoke solutions for targeted queries from various business partners. In this role you will liaise with business partners in many Unilever functions to build the requirements for the front-end, collect the data, build the data model, and present the results to business users and to wider audiences.

If you are someone with strong data analytics expertise and a passion and flair for getting and communicating insights from data to strengthen our team and create business impact, then this role is just for you! You will be a member of the Digital & Data Capability team, which is a diverse team (age, experience, background, nationalities) driving Digital Transformation in Unilever Nutrition R&D.

What Will Your Main Responsibilities Be


Data Collection from multiple sources including SAP PLM, R&D Datalake, existing Power BI datasets, and individual datasets provided by business partners.
Validating underlying data used by the division in the core data sources, and any bespoke datasets used in our reports.
Lead E2E project delivery focused on data extraction, data transformation, dashboard/tool creation as well as drive tool adoption to facilitate strides towards becoming a data-driven organization.
Actively identify opportunities to develop/optimize solutions to drive our Data Analytics strategy with maximum business impact.
Liaising with the System Expertise & User Solutions data squads to ensure data quality in the core systems such that Nutrition data is complete with a clear aim that reporting becomes a routine process.
Develop comprehensive documentation capturing essential project details to re-build the data model and ensures a complete knowledge transfer.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment on project goals, facilitate effective communication, and address any concerns or issues promptly to achieve successful project outcomes.


What You Need To Succeed

Experiences & Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in computer science or data science.
Experience and practice in data management, data quality verification, data visualization, and data integration.
Experience with data visualization and dashboard tools is a plus.
Balanced profile of functional business knowledge/understanding and data/analytics expertise: preferred experience in Nutrition R&D or Supply Chain domain.


Skills


Critical thinking and flexibility to work effectively around technical and business constraints.
Solid experience in data analysis, data visualization, data reporting using Power BI
end-to-end application development, and implementation of front-end (e.g., dashboards and web front-ends).
Applied experience in Visual Analytics Platforms like Microsoft Power BI.
Strong knowledge in designing efficient, robust, and automated data pipelines and ETL workflows.
SAP PLM: usage knowledge and expertise and associated data portals to extract data.
Ability to quickly adapt to changing requirements and priorities, while effectively collaborating with team members through regular sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives to ensure continuous delivery of high-quality, incremental value.
SAP PLM: understands data standards in building hierarchies and specification contents is a plus.
Experience using R or Python is desirable
Proficiency in SQL is highly desirable


Capabilities


Fluent in English
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration skills.
Values inclusivity and work effectively in multi-functional, multi-cultural and multi-located teams.
Passion for continuous learning and transforming self and others to bring value.
Favourable experience in agile project management and change management.
Ability to communicate data expertise work in ‚Äúdifferent languages‚Äù based on target audience: stakeholders, experts, R&D community.


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do ‚Äì creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!


Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.
We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40%-60% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office , you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
Home work allowance
Company laptop and mobile phone
Green Mobility Policy.


EXCITED?

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.

Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands
Description:
You will be driving the development of data products for delivering digital solutions for our recently launched peer-to-peer second-hand marketplace, You will be joining a cross-functional product team consisting of colleagues from Product, Engineering and Design (PEDX), to design, implement and deploy digital products at scale. You will also be part of the Data & Machine learning job family, together with Data Engineers, Data Analysts, and Data Scientists. Your job will be a mix of understanding business needs, designing data solutions ‚Äì and of course writing code.




Requirements:




A strong background in analytics, computer science, econometrics or equivalent (at least MS or equivalent)
Proven experience as a data analyst, with a minimum of 5 years in a mid-level role.
Enjoy figuring out how to use math, code and data to derive insights from large datasets in order to solve real-life, fast-paced business problems.
Ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (preferably Power BI)
Experience working with large datasets and databases.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Hands-on and positive attitude
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
Experience with dbt and Google Cloud is a plus
Knowledge on 2-sided marketplaces is a plus




What 3 things from the box above are most important?




Complex data analyses in SQL
Ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights for business stakeholders in the peer-to-peer marketplace
Working as a Data Analyst in a multi-functional product team

Title: Werkstudent Business Analytics/Intelligence (m/w/d)
Place: Echterdingen, Baden-W√ºrttemberg, Germany
Description:
Willkommen bei MADER- deiner Eintrittskarte zu einer aufregenden Karriere als Business Analyst.

Die Welt der Druckluft ist im Wandel - daher suchen wir Menschen, die sich mit uns bewegen.

Entwickele dich bei uns zum AirXperten und hilf uns unsere Vision datengetrieben zu unterst√ºtzen.

Du fragst dich vielleicht, ob du in die Welt der Druckluft passt? Keine Sorge, Erfahrung ist sch√∂n, aber nicht zwingend notwendig. Vor allem Studierende mit einem Schwerpunkt in (Witschafts-) Informatik oder Data Science finden hier die perfekte Gelegenheit, praktische Erfahrungen zu sammeln.

Als Werkstudent (m/w/d) bei uns hast du die M√∂glichkeit, an deinem sowie an unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg mitzuarbeiten und dich aktiv einzubringen.

Du suchst nach einer Arbeit mit Sinn und der M√∂glichkeit, sie aktiv zu gestalten und m√∂chtest eigenst√§ndige Themen vorantreiben und eigene Projekte √ºbernehmen? Dann schlie√üe dich unserem Team an!

Aufgaben


Eigenst√§ndiger Aufbau und Pflege von Datenmodellen

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
Description:
We are Sinch. With presence in more than 62 countries, we're a growing global organization that helps amazing companies engage with customers on their mobile phones. And whether you know us or not, you've definitely used our tech. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year.

This is a chance for you to dream even bigger than ever. And because we believe that equal opportunities are the key to our success, no matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face fascinating challenges, building your skills alongside amazing experts. It's not easy to reach every person, on every phone, on every channel, everywhere. Create the software that makes it happen. Join our team as a Data Analyst!

The essence of the role

At Sinch, our focus is on driving growth through organic initiatives. Strong organic growth requires a solid foundation in data to be effective, guiding business strategy and building efficiencies. As part of our newly formed Data Analytics department, you'll collaborate with colleagues from around the world. Our primary goal is to deliver timely insights across the Sinch business, influencing operational optimization and providing tactical or strategic decision recommendations.

We're seeking an individual who is driven to understand the driving factors behind data patterns, whilst still having detailed orientation. Adaptability in a fast-changing environment is crucial, and an appreciation for the diversity of daily challenges is essential. Key partners for this role include multifunctional teams in areas such as Product, Finance, HR, and Sales. We work in a modern tech stack with tools like Snowflake, dbt, Tableau, Power BI.

We understand flexibility matters, so we're open to this being a hybrid role based in Stockholm and reporting to the Analytics Manager.

As Our New Data Analyst, You Will


Strategic Insights and Reports: Provide strategically actionable insights backed with data analysis; develop models and dashboards to track key performance indicators.
Data Model Development: Create and refine models to support our stakeholders' decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Integration: Work closely with various teams (i.e. Data Fabric, Data Warehouse, Product and Finance) to integrate analytics into business processes effectively.
Continuous Improvement: Assess internal resources, documentation, data sources, and reporting continually, striving for improved quality and accuracy.
Spreading Data Culture: Collaborate with the team to support and train stakeholders, aiming to increase data-driven decision-making across our groups.
Project Work: Support and drive various analytics projects through a deep understanding of data and insights.


Who are you?

To Contribute To This Role, You Have


Experience with strategy, business or financial planning, including roles from strategy, audit, finance, modelling, or consultancy.
At least 2 years of proficiency in Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, or similar data visualization software.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in SQL, or a comparable track record in analysing large structured and unstructured datasets.
A bachelor's or master's degree is desirable, ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g., finance, computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics).
Proven experience collaborating with senior stakeholders to solve business problems through data and analytics.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written.


Big Plus!

You'll Stand Out From The Crowd If You Have


Experience working in a global company with colleagues and partners across the world.
Tech, SaaS, or Telecom experience working in a Business-to-business setting.


Preferred Qualities


Growth Mindset: Encourages continuous learning and development, both personally and professionally, and views challenges as opportunities for growth.
Detail-Oriented: Pays meticulous attention to the nuances of data and analytics, ensuring accuracy and precision in all aspects of work.
Adaptability: Demonstrates flexibility in responding to changes in the business environment, maintaining effectiveness in varying situations.
Emotional Intelligence: Possesses the ability to understand and manage one's own emotions, as well as empathize with others, fostering strong workplace relationships.
Innovative Mindset: Encourages thinking outside the box and embracing new ideas and technologies, keeping us at the forefront of industry advancements.
Effective Communication: Exhibits strong skills in expressing ideas and complex data insights clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.


Are you ready? Join us on our journey!

We will review applications on a rolling basis. Apply soon by submitting your application in English.

At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we can only consider applicants who hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

Benefits

At Sinch, we support employees with benefits that adapt regionally, ensuring you have the resources need to thrive. These include health and life insurance, flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.

Our Hiring Process

At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high-performing teams.

Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Solna, Stockholm County, Sweden
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming raw data into actionable insights? My name is Wilhelm Windrup, and I lead the Analytics & Strategy Management team here at Telia Finance. Right now, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team and play a critical role in helping us uncover patterns, trends, and insights that drive business decisions.

Is this your new opportunity?

As a Data Analyst for Telia Finance, you have a great passion for understanding financing business principles and how analytics play a strategic role in supporting it. To achieve analytical goals, you will need to show strong technical and logical thinking skills in working with structured and semi structured data to improve data quality, provide valuable business insights as well as be good communicator.

By applying various statistical and analytical techniques, such as exploratory, inferential, and diagnostic analysis, you will discover new trends and investigate potential causes. Additionally, you will work with databases, programming languages, and data visualization tools to present your findings in a clear and concise manner, ensuring effective communication for decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:


Collect, organize, and interpret large sets of data to identify trends, patterns, and underlying causes.
Work closely with stakeholders to define and test business hypotheses using data-driven insights.
Apply statistical and analytical techniques, including exploratory, inferential, and diagnostic analysis, to discover new trends and identify potential causes.
Utilize databases, programming languages, and data visualization tools to present findings in a clear and concise manner for effective decision-making.


Is this you?

To be successful in this role, we believe you have great experience in data exploration, insights generation and ensuring good data governance. You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, explore, analyze, and disseminate large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to details while maintaining the focus into what is the most important. We believe you are driven and proactively pursing new ideas and opportunities to improve business through data-driven approach.

Telia Finance is a company regulated by the Financial Supervisory Authority and is subject to specific accounting and regulatory requirements. These roles require at least one year of experience in a credit market company or a similar field.

Key competencies:


Strong skills of data modelling, transformation and exploration using SQL, BI tools and/or Python.
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Qlik Sense (preferred), Power BI, Tableau, Looker or similar.
Cloud platform experience, such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform
Background from working in a financial company or credit market company
Experience with data quality improvement along with data governance initiatives.
Experience with databases, programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R), and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Bachelor or higher degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Data Science, or related discipline.
Experience from working in agile development teams is a plus.
Fluent skills in Swedish language


It‚Äôs more than just a job

At Telia Finance, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.

Interested?

If you find this interesting, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply for this job. If you have any questions or just want to hear more, feel free to contact our Talent Partner Caroline √Öberg at caroline.aberg@teliacompany.com or at Linkedin. Location for this position is Solna, Stockholm.

Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. In the last steps of the recruitment process, required controls will be performed.

Last application date is: 27th of February

We look forward to receiving your application!

Welcome to Telia Finance ‚Äì Home to your next big opportunity!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
Description:
Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we‚Äôre also on a mission ‚Äì to build a better world through the power of play.

Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It‚Äôs the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.

As a data analyst in the Player and Data Insights team, you will be responsible for analysing product and player behaviour within Minecraft. You will work with big data to uncover actionable insights about our games and business and work directly with the game team to establish BI reporting, tracking, and insights. You will be the lead voice for the analysis of the intersection live services, gameplay, and player engagement.

Key Responsibilities


Query and analyse big data to uncover high-value insights with direct impact to the Minecraft Gameplay strategy.
Partner closely with game development teams in designing telemetry events to better understand product.
Lead insights projects that guide decisions on product and feature roadmaps, using a variety of data including primary research and survey data.
Brainstorm with stakeholders to direct ambiguous questions or misleading metrics into impactful analysis plans.
Lead telemetry, KPI, and reporting efforts.


Required Qualifications


4-6 years of experience in product analytics
Excellent statistical, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal, visual and written communication skills
Proficient with SQL, bonus if familiar with PySpark (Databricks)
Proficient with statistical attribution techniques


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with guiding the work of a team
Experience in analytics within gaming industry
Passion for gaming and entertainment (and Minecraft!)


What You Need To Know

We‚Äôre looking for candidates who are eligible to work in Sweden. Since our hybrid work model requires two onsite days per week, you‚Äôll need to be based in Stockholm to collaborate with your team and soak up the studio energy.

We are happy to welcome international talent and talent outside Stockholm but will not be able to financially support you relocation. If you are located out of Stockholm relocation is a must.

Mojang Studios

Mojang Studios‚ÄØis a Microsoft-owned‚ÄØgame‚ÄØdeveloper. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We‚Äôre always working on new and exciting ways to expand the‚ÄØMinecraft‚ÄØuniverse.

Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.

We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we‚Äôre also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.

To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by S√∂der M√§larstrand, it‚Äôs filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.

But in the end, it‚Äôs the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you‚Äôll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals ‚Äì all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!

Important note on resumes

Please make sure that all the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we‚Äôd hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!
Show more
HTML:
Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we‚Äôre also on a mission ‚Äì to build a better world through the power of play.

Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It‚Äôs the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.

As a data analyst in the Player and Data Insights team, you will be responsible for analysing product and player behaviour within Minecraft. You will work with big data to uncover actionable insights about our games and business and work directly with the game team to establish BI reporting, tracking, and insights. You will be the lead voice for the analysis of the intersection live services, gameplay, and player engagement.

Key Responsibilities

  • Query and analyse big data to uncover high-value insights with direct impact to the Minecraft Gameplay strategy.
  • Partner closely with game development teams in designing telemetry events to better understand product.
  • Lead insights projects that guide decisions on product and feature roadmaps, using a variety of data including primary research and survey data.
  • Brainstorm with stakeholders to direct ambiguous questions or misleading metrics into impactful analysis plans.
  • Lead telemetry, KPI, and reporting efforts.

Required Qualifications

  • 4-6 years of experience in product analytics
  • Excellent statistical, analytical, and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal, visual and written communication skills
  • Proficient with SQL, bonus if familiar with PySpark (Databricks)
  • Proficient with statistical attribution techniques

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with guiding the work of a team
  • Experience in analytics within gaming industry
  • Passion for gaming and entertainment (and Minecraft!)

What You Need To Know

We‚Äôre looking for candidates who are eligible to work in Sweden. Since our hybrid work model requires two onsite days per week, you‚Äôll need to be based in Stockholm to collaborate with your team and soak up the studio energy.

We are happy to welcome international talent and talent outside Stockholm but will not be able to financially support you relocation. If you are located out of Stockholm relocation is a must.

Mojang Studios

Mojang Studios‚ÄØis a Microsoft-owned‚ÄØgame‚ÄØdeveloper. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We‚Äôre always working on new and exciting ways to expand the‚ÄØMinecraft‚ÄØuniverse.

Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.

We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we‚Äôre also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.

To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by S√∂der M√§larstrand, it‚Äôs filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.

But in the end, it‚Äôs the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you‚Äôll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals ‚Äì all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!

Important note on resumes

Please make sure that all the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we‚Äôd hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Hiller√∏d, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ellab is experiencing rapid growth and is expanding its business intelligence capabilities to support this. Over the last year we‚Äôve been building out the foundation of our Data Warehouse (Microsoft Fabric) and BI Platform (Power BI) and are now looking for a skilled analyst to join our BI & Data Team to build out the reporting on top.




What will you be doing in the role?




You‚Äôll be joining the team as our fifth member and our first Analyst on the Team.

The Team currently consist of 4 engineers building ETL pipelines, the data warehouse and Enterprise Semantic Models in Power BI. With you on the Team, we‚Äôll own the full value chain from extracting facts from transactional systems all the way to a final report for consumption by colleagues in our business functions.

As an Analyst you‚Äôll be fully dedicated to translating the enterprise semantic models into reporting in close collaboration with subject matter experts across business functions. The day-to-day focus will be on working with the SMEs to alleviate business pains through the creation of an actional reporting setup to support decision-making. The majority of your future stakeholders are based in the Group HQ in Hiller√∏d, but some are based in our subsidiaries across Europe and North America.

Ellab‚Äôs current reporting landscape is a patchwork of a legacy BI solution and reporting happening in Excel based on manual data extracts. With the introduction of our new BI Platform the ambition is to quickly achieve sufficient reporting parity to decommission the existing solutions. Achieving this will be a group effort between you, the remainder of the team and SME‚Äôs especially within Finance, Operations & Consulting.

We see you as the person responsible for implementing the front end of the company‚Äôs new reporting landscape




Skills you‚Äôll bring to Ellab




Ellab‚Äô BI Platform of choice is Power BI, and you feel at home consuming preexisting semantic models and translate them into reports and dashboards.

You enjoy close collaboration with business specialists help them create the reports needed to make data-backed decisions. You have most likely been working with it for at least a couple of years.

A large part of the job is helping colleagues transitioning from the existing ad-hoc reporting setup into a centralised, structured setup with high reliability and automation. Experience working with SMEs to extract formalised business needs and harmonise definitions is therefore a big plus.

Ellab operates in a range of different fields spanning from manufacturing to a full-blown consultancy business resulting in a complex reporting landscape. Experience working at global enterprise scale with finance, procurement or resource planning departments is a plus.




What we offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Opportunity to influence your own tasks/responsibilities and develop your career in a supportive environment, making a real impact on a growing international company.
You will be joining a team highly focused on execution and process improvement while also recognizing the importance of work-life balance. Our team is flexible, allowing for remote work when necessary.




The Ellab team ‚Äì more than just a job

At Ellab, we take pride in being more than just a workplace. We have a highly active Employee club, lots of social arrangements throughout the year, an annual skiing trip and fitness classes in our gym room.

Culturally, we encourage a positive, welcoming and caring tone. We acknowledge that a feeling of belonging is the foundation of our employee's success ‚Äì Ellab‚Äôs success.




The hiring process

If you think it sounds as exciting as we do, apply to join our team today.

We are conducting interviews continuously and will hire when the right match is found. For any questions about the role, reach out to Virginia Beccaglia on vbe@ellab.com.




We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Metropolitan Area
Description:
Junior Data Analyst - Copenhagen:




Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for turning numbers into insights?

Do you thrive in a collaborative team and love working with stakeholders to drive real business impact?




I am looking for a data driven problem solver to join a dynamic workforce and help them on their digitalization journey.

Joining the business development team means you are a key point of contact for our internal stakeholders - helping to bring new business value through detailed reports.




Your goal? Bring data to the forefront of the business!




Role and Responsibilities:




Play a forward role within the business, helping to achieve strategic goals by leveraging data
Define, design and deliver advanced reporting through Power BI
Using your analytical mindset to find new value from the data
Collaborate with the Data & Analytics Manager to become the key point of contact for internal stakeholders




Key Skills Required:




Previous experience in an analytical or data focused environment
Hands on experience with Power BI and reporting
Strong work ethic as an individual or in a team
Self-starter mentality with confidence in their own ability to solve data focused problems
Fluency in Danish and English




Alongside your Danish counterparts, this business has a large collaboration with a larger team in Sweden.

Cross collaboration on projects is not only expected but promoted.




If you are looking to kick-start your career with a data driven position in a team that wants to see you thrive - then here it is!




d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and business analysis? We are currently looking for a Commercial Data Analyst to support our commercial teams and commercial management. This is a great opportunity to join Kahoot! - One of the world's fastest moving SaaS companies and be part of an exciting growth journey!

At Kahoot!, we believe in people, we believe in pushing boundaries, both for ourselves and for our customers. We challenge the status quo, and that is why both customers and colleagues value us so highly, making us one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in the world.

Our job is to inspire and challenge our customers every day to discover new opportunities, leveraging our platforms and driving world-class employee engagement, learning and communication.

The Commercial Data Analyst reports to the Sales Operations Manager. The position can be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Oslo, Norway.


About Kahoot!

The Kahoot! Group is on a mission to make learning awesome! We want to empower everyone, including children, students, and employees to unlock their full learning potential. Our Kahoot! learning platform makes it easy for any individual or corporation to create, share, and host learning sessions that drive compelling engagement.

Launched in 2013, Kahoot!'s vision is to build the leading learning platform in the world. Since launch, Kahoot! has hosted hundreds of millions of learning sessions with more than 10 billion participants (non-unique) in more than 200 countries and regions. The Kahoot! Group includes Clever, the leading US K-12 EdTech learning platform, together with the learning apps DragonBox, Poio, Drops, Actimo, Motimate, and Whiteboard.fi.

The Kahoot! Group is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, with offices in the US, the UK, France, Finland, Estonia, Denmark, Spain and Poland. To learn more, visit us at kahoot.com, and let's play!


Our K!rew

At the Kahoot! Group we champion a positive culture of collaborative learning and innovation. With a global team of more than 600 employees representing over 50 different nationalities, we're a diverse and fun bunch of people! We work hard and celebrate our wins, tackle challenges with original ideas and learn something new every day.

We are driven by our mission and guided by our values: playful, curious and inclusive.¬†¬†

If you talk to anyone working in the Kahoot! Group, they will tell you that one of the greatest perks is being able to see how the work you do puts a smile on the face of kids, teachers and learners all around the world.¬†


Responsibilities

The Data Analyst 's main responsibility shall be to provide support across all areas of the business. The role will be providing the commercial teams and management with the proactive actionable insights they need to make the right decision so that we can make a positive impact on learning in classrooms and workplaces worldwide.


Make actionable recommendations based on data insights to improve operations, enhance customer experience, or increase profitability
Build and maintain automated dashboards to visualize key metrics and performance trends to management and sales leadership teams
Working closely with the data engineering team responsible for our data analytics platform and Sales, Marketing and Customer Experience to understand their problems and provide them with actionable data analyses
Work closely with key members of the data team to build, maintain and improve reporting systems. This includes owning the quality and flow of commercial data to our data warehouse and the collection of new data.¬†
Collaborating with our CRM team to streamline processes and reporting across our CRM platform (HubSpot) and other relevant tools
Work with relevant teams to ensure seamless integration of data insights into sales processes
Own data quality from a commercial perspective, this includes established clear definitions, secure completeness, enhancement and enrichment of data, and regularly data wash
Develop and maintain key metrics to monitor commercial success and drive continuous improvement
Perform ad-hoc analysis, translate and communicate results to stakeholders



Requirements


A Bachelor or Master degree in a numerate or computing-related subject
+3 years experience in a similar position
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Possess a balanced blend of business acumen and IT expertise
Ability to visualise and interpret complex data sets
Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects
Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives
Fluent using SQL
Experience using Python and Bash is an advantage
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Storage) is an advantage
Experience with Microsoft Power BI and or ThoughtSpot is an advantage



Benefits


A competitive compensation package
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Home broadband allowance
Mobile subscription
Lunch contribution
Hybrid work set up
Flexible working
Buddy program¬†
Social and company events (virtual and in person)
A diverse, friendly and international environment¬†
Modern office in central Copenhagen or Oslo
Show more

  • Fluent using SQL
  • Experience using Python and Bash is an advantage
  • Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Storage) is an advantage
  • Experience with Microsoft Power BI and or ThoughtSpot is an advantage


Benefits

  • A competitive compensation package
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Home broadband allowance
  • Mobile subscription
  • Lunch contribution
  • Hybrid work set up
  • Flexible working
  • Buddy program 
  • Social and company events (virtual and in person)
  • A diverse, friendly and international environment 
  • Modern office in central Copenhagen or Oslo

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We‚Äôre more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of 113 million registered users and 240,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 419+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.132.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation. We are also ready to consider candidates with more work experience as Senior Data Analyst.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go‚Äôs most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you‚Äôre passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
  • You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.

Our values

  • We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
  • We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
  • We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
  • We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
  • We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer

  • An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
  • To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
  • Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
  • We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
  • To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
  • An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
  • We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we‚Äôre searching for a Data Analyst in our Copenhagen office ‚Äì‚ÄØare you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?‚ÄØ

The Role‚ÄØ

As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you‚Äôll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you‚Äôll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


What We‚Äôre Looking For‚ÄØ

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that‚Äôs why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you‚Äôll have at least some experience in the following:‚ÄØ


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data
Strong proficiency in Danish, both written and spoken


It‚Äôs a bonus if you have:‚ÄØ


Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
Background in the streaming or media industry


What we offer you


We‚Äôve got you covered! 25 days + 5 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver‚Äôs seat of your own development.
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product ‚Äì‚ÄØincluding serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.‚ÄØ


Hit play today‚ÄØ

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here ‚Äì‚ÄØyou may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don‚Äôt send us your application via email because we won‚Äôt be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.‚ÄØ

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We‚Äôre only ever a few clicks away.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

Title: BI Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

If you join us in the role of Commercial BI Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Private health insurance
Healthcare cost reimbursements
Sponsored sports activities
Voluntary pension fund (company-sponsored retirement plan or pension)
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


About Your Future Role

We‚Äôre on the lookout for a curious and self-driven data analytics star that will be part of the strong MS Commercial team of BI Developers and data scientists, where our vision is to deliver best in class sales reporting and performance management for our sales organisation within the exciting and growing payment industry. Our team is split between Copenhagen and Frankfurt, so both options are available as home base.

We deliver a governed self-service BI solution driven by our Alteryx Server and PowerBI. Further, we support MS Sales with analytics, reporting and project management of strategic initiatives. We are part of a European team on a mission to scale the performance management infrastructure across existing and new markets, thereby supporting the continued growth ambition across Europe.

You‚Äôll be empowering Commercial teams across Merchant Services

As Commercial BI Developer/Analyst you‚Äôll join an open and sharing community with highly skilled and ambitious colleagues. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You‚Äôll find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

Your key tasks and responsibilities will be to further develop our analytics and reporting capabilities leveraging our Alteryx Server and PowerBI setup to automate our sales performance reporting and help drive sales improvements. Further, you are expected to play an important role in expanding the reporting framework across our European organisation and drive BI development projects independently. An ambitious student will be supporting the team in maintenance and development. You need great stakeholder management skills, as you will be working with stakeholders across Sales, Finance, BI and IT developers to develop best-in-class reporting and defining the hero KPIs to steer our business. Further, you will assist sales directors and team leads to improve their business through sparring and conducting ad hoc analyses and optimisation proposals on selected topics.

What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, it's your potential that sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

Qualifications needed to be successful in this role:


Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree within a relevant field
Experience working with PowerBI or Tableau is a big plus
Experience working with Alteryx is a big plus
Experience working with Sales is a plus
Fluent English both written and spoken is a must


Additional skills and experience that would make you stand out:


Curious
Eager to learn and self-improve
Problem solving mindset
Analytical
A team player


Life at Nexi

Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=standard . Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.

Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

Title: Master Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About the Role:




We are seeking a skilled Master Data Analyst with strong expertise in SAP solutions and supply chain processes, including Extended Warehouse Management (EWM). In this role, you will ensure accurate master data setup and play a critical part in improving processes, collaborating with stakeholders, and maintaining data quality across projects.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze business needs and master data requirements within supply chain and EWM contexts.
Ensure accurate and efficient master data setup in SAP systems.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify pain points, gather requirements, and recommend process improvements.
Support data migration and tool implementation efforts.
Maintain detailed documentation of master data processes and standards.
Identify and resolve data-related issues to ensure consistency and quality.




Experience Required:

Strong experience in SAP solutions, particularly Extended Warehouse Management (EWM).
Solid background in supply chain processes and master data management.
Proven ability to analyze business contexts and gather stakeholder requirements.




Skills Required:

Deep understanding of master data management and IT processes.
Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and process optimization.
Proactive problem-solving and excellent stakeholder collaboration skills.
Knowledge of end-to-end data processes within supply chain systems.




This role will also require occasional visit the the clients offices in the Nordics so before applying please be sure that you are able to do this. If interested, please apply directly to this advert or contact Simon Matthews at X4 Technology.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you‚Äôll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you‚Äôre collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you‚Äôll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care‚Äînot just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we‚Äôre here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in √òsterbro, you‚Äôll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you‚Äôll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Consumer Insights Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Global Consumer Insights Team is the voice of the consumers within the organization ensuring that we keep the consumers at heart in whatever we do. We strive for business impact by blending strategy, research and analytical methodologies to shape the future direction of our brand and products. We take complex business problems, build business recommendations and translate insights into next step actions.

Now we are looking for a true consumer insights enthusiast to join our team in Copenhagen. So, if you want to contribute to identifying business opportunities and shaping the future of our collections and brand with your curious and analytical mind, this could be the job for you!

Your main duties will include:


Drive research projects (primarily survey-based research) alone, or by assisting a consumer insights manager, that impact functions across the business - stretching from collection development to cross functional projects.
Provide on-going analysis of existing data and deep dive on key strategic areas (e.g. on specific materials or consumer segments).
Manage all phases of the market research process including identification and alignment of business objective, project scoping & design, vendor dialogue, execution, analysis, and presentation of results.
Develop relationships with external research vendors and interact with as needed.
Keep abreast of new and current market research techniques and implement innovative solutions, while maximizing insights through analysis from our first party data sources and other.
Collaborate with retail, brand and design teams to infuse insights on product and go-to-market concepts.
Understand stakeholders‚Äô business priorities as well as decision making needs.



We are looking for a unique and talented colleague, who brings along the following:


Postgraduate diploma in a relevant field (Business Administration, Marketing or Economics)
Minimum 2-5 years of professional experience ‚Äì preferably from a similar role with a research company and/or a similar role from a Retail/FMCG/Consumer company.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and strong business acumen, which enables you to quickly understand the key business questions and linking consumer insights into strategic business recommendations.
Solid quantitative research skills including super user of Excel and SPSS as well as statistical understanding and experience with simpler statistical analysis (e.g. factor analysis, significance tests, etc.)
Experience with a variety of quantitative methodologies and knowledge of qualitative research methodologies including planning, scoping and leading research projects while managing vendors and stakeholders in the process.
Exceptional written, visual and verbal communication & presentation skills, i.e. able to deliver structured and simple messages in PowerPoint presentations to key stakeholders.
Passionate and curious colleague with a can-do attitude and a strong drive to independently complete complex tasks and projects within an agreed time frame.
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment while effectively managing multiple priorities and timelines.
Team player with the ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization.
Excellent English proficiency (both written and spoken).



Additional information:

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com .

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.‚ÄØ

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
