HTML:
The Global Consumer Insights Team is the voice of the consumers within the organization ensuring that we keep the consumers at heart in whatever we do. We strive for business impact by blending strategy, research and analytical methodologies to shape the future direction of our brand and products. We take complex business problems, build business recommendations and translate insights into next step actions.

Now we are looking for a true consumer insights enthusiast to join our team in Copenhagen. So, if you want to contribute to identifying business opportunities and shaping the future of our collections and brand with your curious and analytical mind, this could be the job for you!

Your main duties will include:

  • Drive research projects (primarily survey-based research) alone, or by assisting a consumer insights manager, that impact functions across the business - stretching from collection development to cross functional projects.
  • Provide on-going analysis of existing data and deep dive on key strategic areas (e.g. on specific materials or consumer segments).
  • Manage all phases of the market research process including identification and alignment of business objective, project scoping & design, vendor dialogue, execution, analysis, and presentation of results.
  • Develop relationships with external research vendors and interact with as needed.
  • Keep abreast of new and current market research techniques and implement innovative solutions, while maximizing insights through analysis from our first party data sources and other.
  • Collaborate with retail, brand and design teams to infuse insights on product and go-to-market concepts.
  • Understand stakeholders‚Äô business priorities as well as decision making needs.


We are looking for a unique and talented colleague, who brings along the following:

  • Postgraduate diploma in a relevant field (Business Administration, Marketing or Economics)
  • Minimum 2-5 years of professional experience ‚Äì preferably from a similar role with a research company and/or a similar role from a Retail/FMCG/Consumer company.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and strong business acumen, which enables you to quickly understand the key business questions and linking consumer insights into strategic business recommendations.
  • Solid quantitative research skills including super user of Excel and SPSS as well as statistical understanding and experience with simpler statistical analysis (e.g. factor analysis, significance tests, etc.)
  • Experience with a variety of quantitative methodologies and knowledge of qualitative research methodologies including planning, scoping and leading research projects while managing vendors and stakeholders in the process.
  • Exceptional written, visual and verbal communication & presentation skills, i.e. able to deliver structured and simple messages in PowerPoint presentations to key stakeholders.
  • Passionate and curious colleague with a can-do attitude and a strong drive to independently complete complex tasks and projects within an agreed time frame.
  • Must thrive in a fast-paced environment while effectively managing multiple priorities and timelines.
  • Team player with the ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization.
  • Excellent English proficiency (both written and spoken).


Additional information:

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

Description:

At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.

Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments here. For insights into how is life at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.¬†


We‚Äôre looking for an Analytics Specialist to join our team at Precis, working with clients in finance and healthcare -¬†industries that offer exciting and complex analytics challenges.

At Precis, we transform data into value, ensuring our clients have the insights they need for growth while prioritizing user privacy and ethical solutions. You‚Äôll work directly with clients, solve analytics challenges, implement technical solutions, and contribute to commercial processes -¬†all with a focus on data governance and compliance.


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING¬†

Tagging and analytics implementations.

Leading complex collaborations and driving your clients‚Äô analytics roadmap.

Exploring new ways to support clients in regulated industries and drive value out of compliant data.

Delivering actionable insights and supporting your clients‚Äô profitability with data and analytics strategy.

Building dashboards and reports.

Ensuring the best data quality for clients and recommending improvements.

Continuously learning and mastering the latest technologies and techniques in our industry.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR¬†

1+ years of experience working with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.

An understanding of data strategy and digital marketing.

Experience in data analysis and building insights out of extensive data sets.

An interest in privacy, data protection and data governance.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

Previous studies in topics related to data, tech, analytics or business.

A friendly personality with good collaboration skills, plenty of ambitions, and a desire to become a real expert in digital marketing.

[Preffered] Knowledge of SQL and programming languages such as Python or JavaScript.

WHAT WE OFFER
You can read our full offering in our handbook.

An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.

A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that‚Äôs why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.

Transparent salary setting - you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2¬†role within the Analytics¬†column. Check it out!

30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.

A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.

We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.
We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.

Description:

Are you a student interested in data, analytics, and digital marketing? Do you have a background in Business Intelligence, Marketing, or a related field? If you‚Äôre eager to gain real-world experience while studying, this student job is perfect for you!

As a Student Data Strategist, you will support our team in analyzing data, building reports, and extracting insights that help our clients improve their digital marketing performance. You‚Äôll get hands-on experience with industry-leading tools and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the field.


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING¬†

Assist in creating data dashboards to visualize campaign performance using Google Sheets & Looker Studio.

Assist in creating smaller Python applications to extract data from various platforms.

Support the implementation of Precis‚Äô proprietary technology and ensure insights are used in daily optimizations.

Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to generate insights that improve media performance.

Work closely with data strategists and media specialists to test and evaluate new data-driven strategies.

Learn about digital marketing, media buying, and data analytics in a real-world business setting.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR¬†


Currently studying Business Intelligence, Marketing, or similar (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs level) with at least 2 years left of your studies.

Strong analytical mindset with an interest in digital marketing and data-driven decision-making.

Some experience (or coursework) in SQL and/or Python for data analysis.

Some experience (or coursework) in data visualization using tools like Looker Studio or PowerBi.

Experience with Google Sheets/Excel for data analysis.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (Danish is a plus but not required).

WHAT WE OFFER
You can read our full offering in our handbook.

Flexible working hours to accommodate your studies.

Transparent salary setting ‚Äì you can find all our salary bands in our Handbook ‚Äì this role is an L1 role within the Data column. Check it out!

An exceptional workplace marked by noteworthy accomplishments, including securing the Great Place to Work Award, being nominated for the EU Search Awards, and winning the award for the best EMEA Online Sales Google Premier partner.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive on understanding and analyzing data to enhance systems and settlement models?

Do you excel in creating user stories, collaborating across teams, and working with complex energy markets? If so, take a moment to dive deeper.




YOUR MISSION

As a Data Analyst specializing in system services and settlement models in the Nordic energy market, you play a pivotal role in developing and validating settlement models and ensuring their effectiveness.

You collaborate closely with colleagues in the Products, Processes, and Data team and the broader organization.

Your mission is to clarify market mechanisms, develop user stories, and create the core products we deliver to our customers.

Additionally, you support structured and consistent data delivery to meet diverse reporting needs across the business.




DIVE INTO WHAT YOUR DAY-TO-DAY TASKS WILL BE AS A DATA ANALYST

You will:

Build and enhance understanding of system services/flexibility in Denmark and the Nordics
Develop requirements specifications and use cases for system development, focusing on settlement models for system services, in collaboration with the business
Lead testing of developed models, including creating test plans, scenarios etc.
Work closely with the development team to ensure accurate implementation of settlement systems
Establish standards for data presentation and validate data models used across business areas




JOIN A TEAM WITH LIKEMINDED ENERGY

You are joining a dynamic team of five highly skilled Business Analysts. Your team members‚Äô expertise lies in working with market communication protocols, complex settlement models, and data integration across various technologies and markets.

Your team provides top-notch Energy and Auxiliary Services solutions and has a deep understanding of data and business processes. Along with the team, you are tackling complex challenges and driving impactful solutions that support Energi Danmark‚Äôs mission.




What we value:

Collaboration: We believe in the power of teamwork and open communication that helps share knowledge and enhances learning
Innovation: We are always looking for new ways to improve and innovate




LET US SWITCH THE FOCUS TO YOU

Since you will be shaping settlement models and ensuring effective data-driven solutions in the Nordic energy market, we seek a candidate with strong analytical skills and a keen eye for market mechanisms and system optimization.




We also hope you:

are structured and can manage complex tasks in a dynamic, changing environment
have excellent communication skills and can present settlement models clearly and effectively
have experience with data handling and analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Power BI)




We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and identities to apply, as we believe that a diverse team leads to innovation and success.




Please note that this role requires that you are able to communicate in Danish and work from our office location in Aarhus N.




WE MIGHT BE BIASED, BUT IT IS QUITE AWESOME HERE

Building on decades of trading expertise, we are one of the leading trading companies in the Nordics. When you join us, you will be part of an ambitious energy trading company with over 300 employees, working alongside talented and dedicated colleagues. We are on a transformational journey, driving high efficiency in the energy markets and accelerating the energy transition by connecting and serving producers and consumers of renewable energy.




We offer an exciting and dynamic workplace that fosters high ambitions and nurtures a culture of dedication, problem-solving, and a winning mindset. As we navigate a significant transformation, you will find a lot of opportunities for growth, skill development, and specialization with us.




We place great emphasis on the well-being of our employees, both inside and outside the workplace. We prioritize excellent working conditions and offer a comprehensive benefits package, including extra days off, competitive compensation and flexible working hours to promote a healthy work-life balance.




LET US GET THIS CONVERSATION STARTED

If you want to join us ‚Äì do not wait ‚Äì send your resume and application as soon as you can, and no later than March 16.




Keep in mind, we will be interviewing on a rolling basis, so this post might close early if we find the perfect fit.




Got questions or need more details? Reach out to Jeppe Juncker, Head of Product; Processes & Data via email at jeju@energidanmark.dk.




You are at the finish line ‚Äì ready to cross over and join us?

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (Power BI)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you curious about modern technologies with a passion for data and analytics - and want to take part in our new digital journey enabling the world‚Äôs largest enterprise foundation to make informed investment decisions? Then we are looking for you as our new BI specialist to become part of our skilled team of data specialists within the Digital & BI team at our headquarter in Copenhagen.




Novo Holdings is a world-leading life science investor, driven by the purpose of improving people‚Äôs health and the sustainability of society and the planet. Since 1999 we have been investing to promote groundbreaking solutions in healthcare and bio-sustainability while generating attractive returns that advance the Novo Nordisk Foundation‚Äôs grant-giving activities - supporting scientific, humanitarian, and social causes.




We are building out our Business Intelligence and Digital capabilities to be ‚Äòbest-in-class‚Äô, both internally and in the support of our portfolio companies. As part of the Digital & BI team, you will play an important role in reaching our goals by developing and implementing end-to-end data solutions in the Power BI. This includes data modelling, DAX, and visualization. You will work in close collaboration with our Data Engineers, BI developers, Data Scientists, and Investment Professionals, across our global organisation. Our team is part of Novo Holdings‚Äô Finance & Operations function led by our CFO, spanning finance, legal, and dedicated teams working with ESG, Strategy and Responsible Tax.




The Job

The team is driving the overall data agenda within Novo Holdings and by that, supporting the organisation in making informed decisions. Your key responsibilities as our new Business Intelligence Specialist are:




Develop, implement, and maintain end-to-end data and reporting solutions in Power BI (our main reporting tool)
Perform financial analysis to generate clear actionable insights e.g., the financial performance of Novo Holdings and the portfolio companies
Produce reports and presentations related to all reporting areas, including support in the preparation of annual and interim financial reporting to the Leadership Team, the Board of Directors, the investment teams, and the Finance & Operations function
Prepare and provide ad hoc analyses, reporting, and data extracts for all of Novo Holdings
We are cloud-native with infrastructure built in in Azure and Databricks, and reporting in the Microsoft Power Platform, primarily Power BI.
We believe in continuous development, and you will get dedicated time for training, courses, workshops, and certificates




Professional Qualifications

You might be newly graduated, with an MSc degree in BI, with student job experience, or employed in your first role with a couple of years of working experience in a business intelligence development setting. You should have working knowledge of Power BI, including data modelling, DAX, and UI design, but we do not expect you to be an expert. It is great if you have a preference towards either the data modelling, or the UX/UI aspects of Power BI development, but should be comfortable in working with both elements.

We have a strong focus on personal development and support upskilling within relevant fields. It is not a prerequisite, but an advantage if you have experience with one or more of the following:




Databricks
Fabric
Azure and DevOps




Personal Qualifications

As a person you are:




Professional, quality-conscious, and impact-oriented
Curious and eager to learn and work with modern technologies and techniques
Able to convey complex information and interact with both business users and technical specialists
Ambitious, proactive, and have a structured approach to problem-solving
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build good relationships across nationalities and tenures
Independent, take initiative, and communicate effectively and proactively
Capable of working collaboratively within a team, fostering a supportive and inclusive team culture
Able to identify yourself with the Novo Holdings set of values: Performance, Respect, and Responsibility (‚ÄúThe Novo Holdings Way‚Äù).




If you do not meet every single requirement, do not worry‚Äîno one does. We are excited to hear from you and how you can contribute to our team and impact.




Working at Novo Holdings

Our work environment is driven by purpose and values, and we strive to be recognised by our stakeholders and people as an exceptional enterprise.




We employ more than 180 professionals from various nationalities and backgrounds, all sharing the same goal: To generate attractive long-term returns on the assets of the Novo Nordisk Foundation. Our investment teams are spread across offices in San Fransisco, Boston, London, Singapore, and Shanghai - our headquarters is located just north of Copenhagen in Hellerup.




Contact

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible and will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis. We encourage you to send your CV and application as soon as possible or no later than the 19th of February 2025




If you have any questions, please contact Senior Business Intelligence Specialist Aske Laustsen at e-mail: ala@novo.dk

Are you curious about modern technologies with a passion for data and analytics - and want to take part in our new digital journey enabling the world‚Äôs largest enterprise foundation to make informed investment decisions? Then we are looking for you as our new BI specialist to become part of our skilled team of data specialists within the Digital & BI team at our headquarter in Copenhagen.


Novo Holdings is a world-leading life science investor, driven by the purpose of improving people‚Äôs health and the sustainability of society and the planet. Since 1999 we have been investing to promote groundbreaking solutions in healthcare and bio-sustainability while generating attractive returns that advance the Novo Nordisk Foundation‚Äôs grant-giving activities - supporting scientific, humanitarian, and social causes.


We are building out our Business Intelligence and Digital capabilities to be ‚Äòbest-in-class‚Äô, both internally and in the support of our portfolio companies. As part of the Digital & BI team, you will play an important role in reaching our goals by developing and implementing end-to-end data solutions in the Power BI. This includes data modelling, DAX, and visualization. You will work in close collaboration with our Data Engineers, BI developers, Data Scientists, and Investment Professionals, across our global organisation. Our team is part of Novo Holdings‚Äô Finance & Operations function led by our CFO, spanning finance, legal, and dedicated teams working with ESG, Strategy and Responsible Tax.


The Job

The team is driving the overall data agenda within Novo Holdings and by that, supporting the organisation in making informed decisions. Your key responsibilities as our new Business Intelligence Specialist are:


  • Develop, implement, and maintain end-to-end data and reporting solutions in Power BI (our main reporting tool)
  • Perform financial analysis to generate clear actionable insights e.g., the financial performance of Novo Holdings and the portfolio companies
  • Produce reports and presentations related to all reporting areas, including support in the preparation of annual and interim financial reporting to the Leadership Team, the Board of Directors, the investment teams, and the Finance & Operations function
  • Prepare and provide ad hoc analyses, reporting, and data extracts for all of Novo Holdings
  • We are cloud-native with infrastructure built in in Azure and Databricks, and reporting in the Microsoft Power Platform, primarily Power BI.
  • We believe in continuous development, and you will get dedicated time for training, courses, workshops, and certificates


Professional Qualifications

You might be newly graduated, with an MSc degree in BI, with student job experience, or employed in your first role with a couple of years of working experience in a business intelligence development setting.   • Fabric
  • Azure and DevOps


Personal Qualifications

  • Able to convey complex information and interact with both business users and technical specialists
  • Ambitious, proactive, and have a structured approach to problem-solving
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build good relationships across nationalities and tenures
  • Independent, take initiative, and communicate effectively and proactively
  • Capable of working collaboratively within a team, fostering a supportive and inclusive team culture
  • Able to identify yourself with the Novo Holdings set of values: Performance, Respect, and Responsibility (‚ÄúThe Novo Holdings Way‚Äù).


If you do not meet every single requirement, do not worry‚Äîno one does. We are excited to hear from you and how you can contribute to our team and impact.


Working at Novo Holdings

Our work environment is driven by purpose and values, and we strive to be recognised by our stakeholders and people as an exceptional enterprise.


We employ more than 180 professionals from various nationalities and backgrounds, all sharing the same goal: To generate attractive long-term returns on the assets of the Novo Nordisk Foundation. Our investment teams are spread across offices in San Fransisco, Boston, London, Singapore, and Shanghai - our headquarters is located just north of Copenhagen in Hellerup.

Title: Junior Data Analyst / Business Analyst ‚Äì Financial Data Compliance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst / Business Analyst with 1-5 years of experience to support data validation and analysis in a regulated financial environment. The ideal candidate is an Excel super-user with a strong analytical mindset and the ability to work with large datasets containing personal and transactional information.

This role focuses on data quality analysis within FATCA/CRS regulatory reporting, ensuring accuracy and consistency in critical financial data.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze and identify data inconsistencies and quality issues within large datasets, based on predefined validation frameworks.
Compare and correlate multiple datasets, identifying patterns, discrepancies, and anomalies.
Understand database logic and XML structures to interpret data flows and dependencies.
Summarize data validation findings, presenting structured insights to facilitate corrections.
Work independently and systematically to ensure compliance with FATCA/CRS regulatory requirements.
Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to understand validation rules and apply them effectively.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Excel super-user with the ability to handle large and complex datasets.
Strong logical reasoning and problem-solving skills.
Ability to analyze database structures and data logic.
Experience working with large datasets containing sensitive personal and transactional data.
Ability to understand and interpret XML structures.
Highly structured and detail-oriented approach to data validation and analysis.
Strong communication skills to summarize and report data issues effectively.


Preferred Skills


SQL skills (basic query writing and data extraction).
Experience in financial reporting, auditing, or compliance-related data analysis.
Educational background in Finance, Controlling, Auditing, Data Science, or related fields.


Contract Details


Start Date: ASAP
Duration: 1 Month
Workload: Full-time

Performance Management Analyst

Job Family: Group staff

Business Unit: DLF Finance & IT

Location:

Roskilde, DK, 4000

Analyst with Performance Management

DNA


Turn data in to actionable insights and help Executive Management and the organization grow the business


DLF is a global leader within forage and turf seeds, situated in Denmark, Roskilde (soon in a new Headquarter in Sm√∏rum) with roughly 2,000 employees across more than 20 countries, serving customers in 100 countries. We are on an exciting journey as our Executive Management has set ambitious targets for the global company over the next 3 years under our newly formed Group Strategy ‚ÄúConnecting to Grow‚Äù.

We are looking for talent to come and help us!

Do you want to be the ‚Äômissing link‚Äô in our Business Finance team with focus on Performance Management, so we grow the business, both organically and through acquisitions?

Performance Management, was created in the beginning of 2024 as part of a newly formed Business Finance function ‚Äì build to improve business focus, standardization and scalability. Our main purpose is to drive the business dialogue by creating transparency and fuel fact-based decision making for Executive Management, Commercial & Financial leadership and the Board of Directors.

You will work with Performance Management, converting data in to actionable insights

Your focus will be on developing the needed tools and processes, that can facilitate both existing dialogues and generate new ones. Your main tools will be Excel, PowerPoint (& Thinkcell) and PowerBI and your responsibilities can fall within any of the below areas


Develop, build and maintain analytical tools to create and improve transparency on relevant performance metrics for management in Executive leadership and SBUs, that allows for leaders to quickly understand and act on relevant business insights
Drive the monthly reviews as well as Forecast reviews and facilitate the process with relevant tools & packages for CEO and CFO to fuel professional, fact-based and relevant business discussions
Develop high-quality presentations for EMB and BoD to ensure the best possible dialogue and clarity around business-critical discussions and actions
Support Senior leadership with relevant ad-hoc analysis and insights to help understand the business and potential challenges


We are a small team who drive this agenda and we are looking for a Performance Management Analyst who wants to work within the sphere of Performance Management and help DLF navigate to grow the business.

This is you!

We are looking for an engaged, bright and eager graduate who is at the beginning of their career. You see the DLF journey as an exciting career opportunity and want to improve your skills within the field of performance management. Your attitude to contribute to our purpose and your fit with the team and the rest of Business Finance is what we care about the most!

Other than that, If you can check most of the boxes off below we would really like to hear from you!


‚ÄòPerformance management‚Äô, ‚Äònumbers‚Äô, ‚ÄòExcel‚Äô, ‚ÄòPowerBI‚Äô and ‚ÄòFinancial/commercial analysis‚Äô are all key words that you want to work with!
You bring an engaged and friendly attitude to work ‚Äì and you want to learn and contribute
You have a relevant degree within Economics or equivalent preferably with 1-2 years of relevant experience
You have experience working with financial tools in Excel and/or PowerBI as well as the underlying data models
You are open to a blend of new as well as operational tasks
You think DLF sounds like a great place to work, and can see yourself here long-term


You speak English fluently (Corporate Finance includes nationalities from around the world and Danish is not a prerequisite)

This is us!

Performance Management is a new and young team and together with Business Finance we are 7 in total, consisting of diverse backgrounds both with long-time experience in DLF as well as new hires. Common to us all, is that we appreciate a fun and relaxed atmosphere though with an unwavering focus on being ambitious about the value we create for the business. As a member of the team we can offer you


An exciting workplace where we will support your growth and develop your skills based on where you are. We are looking for an analyst, but want to hire for a career.
Balance and flexibility. It is equally important for us to be ambitious and deliver what we promise as it is to ensure we have fun on the way and can enjoy our private lives. We all appreciate to be together at the office but equally support the option to work from home when it is needed.
Immediate contribution and exposure ‚Äì As a small team with an array of different potential tasks you will get immediate responsibility serving key stakeholder groups including the Group CEO and CFO as well as Executive Management, the Board of Directors and other senior leadership. The tools and insight you provide will bring value at a high level and contribute to drive the business dialogue forward.
A brand-new Headquarter in Sm√∏rum is currently under construction and will be ready in late 2025 where we will move in to state-of-the-art facilities.


Are you intrigued? Are you ready to take your career to the next level?

Then upload us a motivated CV, and tell us why you‚Äôre the right candidate for the role. We aim to conduct the first interviews during week 9-10 so do not hesitate to make your submission. We look forward to hear from you and welcoming you to DLF and our team!

If you have questions do not hesitate to reach out to Head of Performance Management, Lasse Severin Hansen +45 2082 4787. If you want to learn more about DLF check out www.dlf.com

Apply now ¬ª

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us, be part of more.

We‚Äôre so much more than an energy company. We‚Äôre a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that‚Äôs energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn‚Äôt rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That‚Äôs why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently ‚Äì we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

About your team:

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team‚Äôs model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we‚Äôre looking for:


Master‚Äôs Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We‚Äôre not a perfect place ‚Äì but we‚Äôre a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we‚Äôre a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data & Solution
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:‚ÄØ 27655

We are looking for an experienced professional with solid knowledge of the banking industry and experience in working with technology/IT to develop Nordea‚Äôs Nordic banking book collateral management capabilities. This is full time and permanent Analyst or Senior analyst position.

About Our Team

Meet the Collateral Capability‚Äôs Data & Solution team. Our role is to build and maintain safe and trusted cross Nordic collateral management processes, solutions and data. We work as a group level centralized unit, collaborating closely with stakeholders across all Nordea business areas.

Our team is part of Group Credit Management organization. We have currently 8 team members located in Helsinki, Stockholm and Oslo.

Team‚Äôs mission is to build and maintain safe and trusted cross Nordic collateral management processes, solutions and data. We work as a group level centralized unit, collaborating closely with stakeholders across all Nordea business areas. We play a crucial role in developing and supporting processes for e.g. credit risk assessments, ESG assessments, collateral valuations and risk models.

We drive cooperation along the value chain to ensure that solutions and processes are being developed and operated in the most efficient way. We seek opportunities to improve and optimize processes by utilizing innovation, automation, continuous improvements and advanced data analysis.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing‚ÄØ

Main responsibilities in this role:


Supporting development, roll-out, and maintenance of common Nordea Collateral Solution (NCS) application from a business/functional point of view
Finding and driving changes and functional improvements to NCS
Supporting business stakeholders with leveraging collateral data in reporting, analysis and risk models
Collaborating with Application Maintenance (IT) to secure good application management and support
Securing compliance with Nordea Application Management and Data Governance frameworks


Who You Are

This is the right role for you if you:


Are eager to learn more about collateral management including business processes, IT solutions and data
See creativity and strong problem-solving skills as your strength
Are able to set your own agenda, can prioritise and can act as a driver to get things done


Your background and skills include:


Master's or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information technology/Computer Science/Economics or related field
At least 4 years of experience in application or process development in roles like analyst, project manager or product owner
Fluency in spoken and written English
Experience in application development, data models and APIs can be beneficial


It would be ideal if you also:


Have experience in banking book collateral management processes, applications or data
Have at least basic skills in SQL and data analysis


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it‚Äôs to take their career to the next level. For others, it‚Äôs to break new ground within their area of expertise ‚Äì in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model ‚Äì we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!‚ÄØ

Next steps‚ÄØ

Submit your application no later than 20/02/2025.‚ÄØ For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Jarno Sepp√§nen at jarno.seppanen@nordea.com or Teams.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do ‚Äì when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers‚Äô needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

HTML:
Job ID:‚ÄØ 27655

We are looking for an experienced professional with solid knowledge of the banking industry and experience in working with technology/IT to develop Nordea‚Äôs Nordic banking book collateral management capabilities. This is full time and permanent Analyst or Senior analyst position.

About Our Team

Meet the Collateral Capability‚Äôs Data & Solution team. Our role is to build and maintain safe and trusted cross Nordic collateral management processes, solutions and data. We work as a group level centralized unit, collaborating closely with stakeholders across all Nordea business areas.

Our team is part of Group Credit Management organization. We have currently 8 team members located in Helsinki, Stockholm and Oslo.

Team‚Äôs mission is to build and maintain safe and trusted cross Nordic collateral management processes, solutions and data. We work as a group level centralized unit, collaborating closely with stakeholders across all Nordea business areas. We play a crucial role in developing and supporting processes for e.g. credit risk assessments, ESG assessments, collateral valuations and risk models.

We drive cooperation along the value chain to ensure that solutions and processes are being developed and operated in the most efficient way. We seek opportunities to improve and optimize processes by utilizing innovation, automation, continuous improvements and advanced data analysis.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing‚ÄØ

Main responsibilities in this role:

  • Supporting development, roll-out, and maintenance of common Nordea Collateral Solution (NCS) application from a business/functional point of view
  • Finding and driving changes and functional improvements to NCS
  • Supporting business stakeholders with leveraging collateral data in reporting, analysis and risk models
  • Collaborating with Application Maintenance (IT) to secure good application management and support
  • Securing compliance with Nordea Application Management and Data Governance frameworks

Who You Are

This is the right role for you if you:

  • Are eager to learn more about collateral management including business processes, IT solutions and data
  • See creativity and strong problem-solving skills as your strength
  • Are able to set your own agenda, can prioritise and can act as a driver to get things done

Your background and skills include:

  • Master's or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information technology/Computer Science/Economics or related field
  • At least 4 years of experience in application or process development in roles like analyst, project manager or product owner
  • Fluency in spoken and written English
  • Experience in application development, data models and APIs can be beneficial

It would be ideal if you also:

  • Have experience in banking book collateral management processes, applications or data
  • Have at least basic skills in SQL and data analysis

What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it‚Äôs to take their career to the next level. For others, it‚Äôs to break new ground within their area of expertise ‚Äì in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model ‚Äì we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!‚ÄØ

Next steps‚ÄØ

Submit your application no later than 20/02/2025.‚ÄØ For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Jarno Sepp√§nen at jarno.seppanen@nordea.com or Teams.

Title: Analyst
Place: Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a background in data and a passion for using data and automation methodologies to generate meaningful insights and solve real business problems? Are you keen on working in a complex stakeholder landscape and have expertise in collecting and modelling large, unstructured data?

If so, submit an application to join Novo Nordisk Procurement's Advanced Analytics team. Together, we can drive the analytics journey even further and produce greater advantages for our patients all over the world. Apply now!

The position
As an Analyst within Data Engineering and Automation track in Corporate Procurement, you will work in close collaboration with experienced project managers, system experts, analytics partners and Procurement professionals across our global organisation to drive value creation by leveraging advanced analytics.

You will be part of the Advanced Analytics team consisting of strong and experienced analysts, data partners, and data engineers where you will be responsible for:



Creating and maintaining high-quality automated data pipeline architecture in Azure and Alteryx, incl. building SQL-based data processing and transformation logic
Driving continuous improvements in our ETL process to further improve data quality and availability
Orchestrating data integration workflows and ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of data for an ongoing system integration project
Developing, deploying, and optimising data-driven applications in other platforms (e.g. Python and Power Platform) to drive efficiency gains in strategic projects




Qualifications

As our ideal candidate, you are expected to:



Have completed a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Finance, Economics, Engineering or similar with excellent results
Have 0-2 years of experience in data engineering or related fields, preferably involving unstructured big data collection and modelling using various data sources
Navigate within a complex stakeholder landscape
Have hands-on experience with ETL tools (e.g., Alteryx, Azure and SQL) and Power Platform
Experience with other tools such as Python and UI/UX is a plus




As a person, you are structured in your problem-solving approach, detail-oriented while being able to maintain a holistic perspective, curious, think out of the box and willing to explore multiple unconventional approaches. Your colleagues can describe you as a strong team member with a proactive, can-do attitude.

About The Department

Corporate Procurement is the Centre of Excellence for procurement in Novo Nordisk. We are responsible for the global procurement strategy, processes, and systems. We negotiate contracts covering more than DKK 70 billion of Novo Nordisk‚Äôs spend. Global Procurement has 500 employees around the world with the largest hubs in Denmark, India and the US.

A key enabler for taking Procurement to the next level will be to leverage holistic insights to drive value in and from procurement. The Advanced Analytics team is responsible for driving this journey.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk we don't wait for change. We drive it. We're a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales - we're all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please contact the Senior Director of Advanced Technology, An Tran at ABQT@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
21st of February 2025

The position is to be filled as soon as possible. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so please submit your application and cover letter as soon as possible.

To ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV or resume.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.
Show more

Title: People Data and Analytics Coordinator
Place: Struer, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Craft the Future of People Data at Bang & Olufsen!

Are you ready to turn data into impact?

At Bang & Olufsen, we are looking for a motivated and data-savvy individual with a keen interest in people data analytics. The ideal candidate should have some experience with HR systems, such as SuccessFactors or similar, and a basic understanding of ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) and/or CSRD (Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive) data requirements. We are seeking someone passionate about learning and contributing to continue building the foundation of people data processes and using technology to improve data quality, accessibility, and insights. You will also play an important role in preparing to support our commitment to equity, fairness, and compliance by helping to ensure adherence to the pay transparency standards.

As a People Data and Analytics Coordinator, you will assist in shaping the continued focus on data and insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to help ensure that our people data infrastructure supports operational needs, strategic objectives, sustainability efforts, and compliance with pay transparency initiatives.

Key Responsibilities



Provide support in analyzing key people data, identifying trends, and delivering clear reports and dashboards to the key stakeholders.
Assist in continuously strengthening the foundation of people data.
Help develop, implement, and automate data processes for ESG and CSRD reporting, ensuring compliance with evolving regulations and supporting sustainability goals.
Collaborate with cross functional teams to streamline data flows, improve system integration, and ensure data integrity across platforms.
Assist in creating and implementing data governance practices to ensure accuracy, consistency, and security in people data.
Assist the global Head of Performance & Reward in reporting total reward data and in establishing a robust foundation for compensation data analytics, incl. ensuring we meet requirements to deliver on pay transparency reporting.



What You Bring



Basic knowledge of working in HR Systems and experience in extracting and analyzing data to support business needs.
Interest in digital transformation initiatives, with a focus on automating and improving people data processes.
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau) is a plus.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proactive, solution-oriented mindset with good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment while managing multiple tasks.
A degree in Human Resources, Data Analytics, Business Administration, Sustainability, or a related field is preferred but not required.



What We Offer

A key role in the global People & Culture team with opportunities to grow and to influence the transformation of our people data infrastructure. Our working culture is characterized by high degree of flexibility, trust and supporting each other. The teams work at a high pace, whilst always having openness to new input, ideas and suggestions of changes.

With approximately 1,100 employees, Bang & Olufsen is an agile company that gives room for individual flexibility and decision-making. Our hierarchy is flat, and our communication is open and trustworthy. We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits package.

Location: Struer, Denmark; Kongens Lyngby, Denmark.

Start date: As soon as possible.

Travel: Approx. 5 %

How To Apply

Submit your CV and application in English by pressing the ‚ÄòApply‚Äô button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than 23rd February.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact our Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, Antoniya Petkov on ANTP@bang-olufsen.dk. Please do not send your CV and application to this e-mail directly as these will not be taken into consideration.

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here .

Bang & Olufsen has, for 100 years, developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.
Show more

Title: Graduate - AI & Data (Copenhagen) | Starting in August 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
What if your curiosity could help build the world, we all imagine?

Kickstart your career with AI & Data at EY this August together with other curious graduates. We‚Äôre dedicated to investing in your potential, providing guidance and supporting you on your journey with us.

The role and opportunities

As a Graduate in AI & Data you‚Äôll join our consulting services and gain invaluable experience collaborating with diverse clients across a range of sectors and industries. Our team consists of 25 passionate professionals from varied educational and cultural backgrounds, creating a rich and inclusive workplace environment.

As you advance in your role, you will be equipped to leverage AI and data capabilities to help our clients effectively manage risks and align their business objectives. You will be part of a vibrant ecosystem that empowers you to enhance your skills, innovate with cutting-edge technologies, and build a rewarding career within AI and data.

In AI & Data, We Assist Clients Across Various Industries In Transforming Their Organizations Into Data-driven Enterprises Where Trusted Intelligence And AI Offerings Is Embedded In Daily Operations. We Are Data-driven Individuals With Expertise In Several Competencies, Including


Data Science (AI, GenAI, Machine Learning & Modelling, Statistics, NLP, ‚Ä¶)
Data Engineering (Data ingestion, Data Storage, ETL, Data Pipelines, ...)
Data Architecture (Enterprise Data Architecture, Integrations, Data Modelling & Design, ‚Ä¶)
Data Management (Data Strategy, Data Quality Management, Governance, Master Data, Data Lineage, Data Security & Privacy, ‚Ä¶)


You will experience a broad spectrum of work opportunities designed to help you grow professionally while fostering a culture of global teamwork and collaboration. You'll be surrounded by supportive colleagues and immersed in a diverse culture, enabling you to reach your full potential. Beyond work, we also organize various social events, such as cooking classes and eventful Friday bars to strengthen our team spirit.

Through our internal coaching and training programs, you‚Äôll acquire essential skills to stay relevant today and, in the future, while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who support you at EY and beyond. This is your chance to shape your career as you envision it.

Your profile


You are adaptable and innovative on technology. You are agile and adaptable to changing environments and technologies, and you have a keen interest in making a difference within the AI & data field. You are geeky on tech and able to interact seamlessly with business stakeholders.
You are analytical and have a problem-solving attitude. and solving actual business problems and creating value for our clients.
You are an inclusive team player. We are looking for someone who can lead and inspire and are passionate about continuous learning and staying up to date on industry trends.
Qualifications:
You completed your studies in 2024 or are set to graduate in 2025 with a degree within technology, data and/or AI.
You speak and write English fluently, and you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

What We Offer


An exciting introductory program with all new graduates in the Nordic region.
A supportive onboarding process with your own personal buddy and counselor.
Flexible and hybrid-working conditions, enabling you to make a meaningful impact, your way.
Highly collaborative teams and a network of knowledgeable colleagues.
Continuous development and opportunities to advance your career through learnings and experiences.


Apply now!

If you find this position intriguing and see yourself in the description above, we would love to hear from you. Application deadline: March 9, 2025.

Our Recruitment Process Includes The Following Steps


Application: Fill out the application form and upload your CV along with your most recent grade transcript.
Assessment: After submitting your application, you will receive a link to our gamified assessment within a few days. The assessment takes approximately 8 minutes to complete.
Video: Upon completing the assessment, you will be invited to submit a short video application answering three questions that explain your motivation for applying. This is a pre-recorded interview that you can complete at your convenience.


You need to complete both the assessment and video by March 13, 2025, at 11:59 PM. Detailed instructions will be provided via email.

You will only be considered for the position once all steps have been completed. Selected candidates will be invited to two rounds of in-person interviews, including one case interview. These interviews will take place in April 2025.

We will notify all candidates after the application deadline. We look forward to receiving your application!

Get to know us. You can already now start to follow us on Instagram (ey_denmark)

At EY we celebrate differences and support it. Our employees bring their authentic selves to work every day. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, and are committed to creating an inclusive EY environment for all employees. EY is an equal opportunity employer for employees and applicants. EY encourages applications from all backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
Show more

  • Flexible and hybrid-working conditions, enabling you to make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Highly collaborative teams and a network of knowledgeable colleagues.
  • Continuous development and opportunities to advance your career through learnings and experiences.

Apply now!

If you find this position intriguing and see yourself in the description above, we would love to hear from you. Application deadline: March 9, 2025.

Our Recruitment Process Includes The Following Steps

  • Application: Fill out the application form and upload your CV along with your most recent grade transcript.
  • Assessment: After submitting your application, you will receive a link to our gamified assessment within a few days. The assessment takes approximately 8 minutes to complete.
  • Video: Upon completing the assessment, you will be invited to submit a short video application answering three questions that explain your motivation for applying. This is a pre-recorded interview that you can complete at your convenience.

You need to complete both the assessment and video by March 13, 2025, at 11:59 PM. Detailed instructions will be provided via email.

You will only be considered for the position once all steps have been completed. Selected candidates will be invited to two rounds of in-person interviews, including one case interview. These interviews will take place in April 2025.

We will notify all candidates after the application deadline. We look forward to receiving your application!

Get to know us. You can already now start to follow us on Instagram (ey_denmark)

At EY we celebrate differences and support it. Our employees bring their authentic selves to work every day. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, and are committed to creating an inclusive EY environment for all employees. EY is an equal opportunity employer for employees and applicants. EY encourages applications from all backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Student Worker - Data Analyst
Place: Brande, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa is part of Siemens Energy, a global leader in energy technology with a rich legacy of innovation spanning over 150 years. Together, we are committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. As a leading player in the wind industry and manufacturer of wind turbines, we are passionate about driving the energy transition and providing innovative solutions that meet the growing energy demand of the global community. At Siemens Gamesa, we are constantly seeking talented individuals to join our team and support our focus on energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Gamesa: Working with us.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

We are looking for a self-driven student worker to support our Business Controlling Technology department in Brande.

Being a Student Worker in Siemens Gamesa is an opportunity for you to develop your personal capabilities and build a professional and international network. You will get the chance to enhance your professional development and get relevant work experience in a global company.

Your Responsibilities Will Consist Of


Managing & analyzing data
The tasks will also vary depending on your previous experience as well as how long you will be staying


What You Need To Make a Difference

Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for someone who is currently enrolled at the university (bachelor or master‚Äôs) in Business Administration, Economics, Information Technology, Technology Based Business Development, Engineering (or similar). If you already have some experience with logistic work from a previous job, it is considered a huge advantage.

To Be Successful In This Role, You Need/are


Working knowledge using Microsoft Office Tools, especially Excel, Power BI is important
Additional system knowledge within SAP and Teamcenter is preferred
An understanding about data work & management
A good communicator who feels comfortable reaching out to multiple stakeholders
Excellent English skills, both written & spoken
Proactive & have a can-do attitude
A team player who thrives in a multicultural team
Able to perform work individually (with guidance when required)
Able to take responsibility for the work, which you deliver


Beware, we are looking for a student, who can come into the office in around 1-2 times a week, and more in the beginning.

Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. You have a high professional competency, and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration skills, and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. To thrive in this position, you must have a strong result- and customer-oriented approach.

In return of your commitment, we offer you‚Ä¶

To become a part of our mission for sustainability: clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsidized lunch, employee discounts and much more.

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

#Studentworker

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team via Maia Coombs on maia.coombs.ext@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Please apply in English via the apply button with your CV and a motivational letter

For more information about working in Denmark, please see this link: https://www.siemensgamesa.com/explore/journal/wind-engineers-in-denmark

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Join us, be part of more.

We‚Äôre so much more than an energy company. We‚Äôre a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that‚Äôs energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn‚Äôt rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That‚Äôs why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently ‚Äì we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

About your team:

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team‚Äôs model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we‚Äôre looking for:


Master‚Äôs Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We‚Äôre not a perfect place ‚Äì but we‚Äôre a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we‚Äôre a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.
