We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:

  • Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
  • Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
  • Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.

As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Produce high quality increments to the team‚Äôs model library working both individually and collaboratively
  • Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
  • Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.

What we‚Äôre looking for:

  • Master‚Äôs Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
  • Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
  • Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
  • Experience of code development (ideally Python)
  • Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
  • Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
  • Strong interpersonal skills.

Why should you apply?

We‚Äôre not a perfect place ‚Äì but we‚Äôre a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we‚Äôre a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

Title: Data Analyst, Investment Proposals - Parametric
Place: Frederikssund, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management and investment management services. With offices in more than 41 countries, the Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. For further information about Morgan Stanley, please visit www.morganstanley.com.

About Parametric

Parametric is part of Morgan Stanley Investment Management, the asset management division of Morgan Stanley. We partner with advisors, institutions, and consultants to build portfolios focused on what's important to them and their clients. A leader in custom solutions for more than 30 years, we help investors access efficient market exposures, solve implementation challenges, and design multi-asset portfolios that respond to their evolving needs. We also offer systematic alpha and alternative strategies to complement clients' core holdings.

This role is part of Parametric's hybrid working model, which includes working in the office 3 days a week and choosing to work remotely or in the office the remaining days of the week.

About The Role

The Analyst is responsible for assisting in the support of the Institutional and Wealth Management sales teams with quantitative data for recurring and ad hoc due diligence requests with a particular focus on firm and strategy level information. The Investment Proposal team serves as the hub through which information is compiled and disseminated to both internal and external clients. The position requires collaboration with multiple teams so we are looking for an individual with a positive attitude and high initiative that has demonstrated the ability to work collaboratively. The candidate must be detail oriented and have excellent communication and organizational skills.

Primary Responsibilities May Include


Responsible for supporting/completing monthly, quarterly, annual and ad hoc data compilation for:
Databases (Morningstar, eVestment, etc.)
RFPs/RFIs/DDQs
Strategy-level client reporting
Marketing materials
Utilize FactSet and internal data systems to compile comprehensive quantitative reporting including holdings, characteristics, performance attributions, AUM and personnel stats.
Provide ad hoc analysis and support for Institutional Sales and Wealth Management departments.
Act as a contributing member of the team, participating on projects guided by Sr. analysts, supervisor and/or management
Maintain a sense of curiosity. Foster a positive attitude and look out for continuous/incremental improvements.
Develop a specialized knowledge of all Parametric products and build relationship with internal subject matter experts.
Develop a full working knowledge of the firm's structure, key personnel and organizational policies.
Assume other responsibilities as required.


Job Requirements


4-year degree or equivalent, preferably in a related discipline such as business, finance, or economics.
1-3 years' of related industry/work (inclusive of internships) experience preferred.
Strong math and quantitative skills.
Proficient in Excel including using PivotTables and V-Lookups; proficiency in macro writing or Alteryx/Tableau is a plus.
Intellectually curious.
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle a heavy, deadline-oriented workload.
Ability to successfully navigate simultaneous multi-level projects and tasks in a team environment.
Working knowledge of statistics and equity risk models is a plus.
Familiarity with FactSet, and other investment analysis tools is a plus.


What You Can Expect From Morgan Stanley

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 85 years. At our foundation are five core values ‚Äî putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back ‚Äî that guide our more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. At Morgan Stanley, you‚Äôll find trusted colleagues, committed mentors and a culture that values diverse perspectives, individual intellect and cross-collaboration. We Firm is differentiated by the caliber of our diverse team. While our company culture and commitment to inclusion define our legacy and shape our future, helping to strengthen our business and bring value to clients around the world. Learn more about how we put this commitment to action: morganstanley.com/diversity. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry.

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Salary range for the position: $70,000 - 150,000/Yr. The successful candidate may be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive compensation award. The successful candidate may be eligible to participate in the relevant business unit's incentive compensation plan, which also may include a discretionary bonus component. Morgan Stanley offers a full spectrum of benefits, including Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Dependent Day Care Savings Account, Life Insurance, Disability and Other Insurance Plans, Paid Time Off (including Sick Leave consistent with state and local law, Parental Leave and 20 Vacation Days annually), 10 Paid Holidays, 401(k), and Short/Long Term Disability, in addition to other special perks reserved for our employees. Please visit mybenefits.morganstanley.com to learn more about our benefit offerings.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The business

Driversnote is a product-centric and profitable SaaS company in the heart of Copenhagen. We proudly help over 3 million users across more than 50 countries log their mileage. No one enjoys the hassle of mileage documentation. We automate and simplify this tedious task, and make our customer‚Äôs work-life easier while saving them both time and money.




We are 35 people working closely together on design, mobile and web development, marketing, support, sales and customer success.




At Driversnote, you will enjoy the benefits of working at a company that has a clear product-market fit and is fully owned and operated by the founder team. We're profitable and have quadrupled our ARR over the last three years. Our scale will allow you to operate in a truly data-driven fashion, and our independence ensures that we always align our decisions with the best interests of our customers and employees.




The product

Driversnote‚Äôs main experience is a highly rated freemium app, to a large extent spread through word of mouth. We offer automatic mileage tracking based on the phone's geo location and in addition, we offer a piece of hardware known as an iBeacon to ensure precision tracking, when you enter your car.




The mobile app is backed by a substantial backend, and at driversnote.com we offer a fully fledged web application with advanced trip management, team management and workflows for teams.




We have a B2C-like relationship with many of our users, but we are gradually moving more and more into traditional B2B space with all that this entails of further product enhancements.




The way we work

We use a product development process known as Shape Up, where a few key people take the role as shapers and define projects that can be designed, implemented and released within 6 weeks, known as cycles. For each 6 week cycle, we form new cross-functional teams with designers, developers, marketeers and customer supporters on them, and we let the teams focus exclusively on finishing their projects within the cycle. Each 6 week cycle is followed by a 2 week cool-down period, where we fix bugs, execute functional projects, evaluate how we did and plan the next cycle.




We like to say that our unfair advantage is that we care more than our competitors, and our users and customers tend to agree when they review our app, respond to NPS surveys and rate our support. We have a generous budget set aside for each employee to learn and develop, and we do a lot of fun stuff together.




The opportunity

We are very data-driven at Driversnote, and with over 3 million users to learn from, that's not just something we say. Data is at the heart of every decision we make, and to us, every change is an experiment and a chance to learn. We use BigQuery as our data warehouse, and use Looker Studio to create reports and dashboards, so it‚Äôs possible to dive right into our data.




Last year we hired our first data analyst fully dedicated to understanding our data and making the most of it. Our increased data capabilities have been a great success, and now we are ready to expand the data analysis team with this additional role and bring even more experience into the company.




The role

As our new Principal Data Analyst, you will report to the CTO and work closely with everyone from senior leaders to product, design, and marketing on maturing the ways we work with and learn from data. As part of your daily life, you will




Own our data warehouse and analytics setup with support from our developers.
Pro-actively identify new opportunities for business growth and improving user experience based on our data.
Service our management team with data and insights supporting strategic decisions.
Take ownership of our experiment setup, assessing hypotheses based on millions of data points.
Drive our build-measure-learn loop by sparring on experiment designs and partner with experiment owners to conclude and learn from results
Support the product, operations and marketing team by having a smooth flow of data and ensuring easy-to-use reporting.
Take a hands-on approach and build, update and customise data sources.
Enable and upskill the data capabilities of everyone in the company to ensure that we can continue to be obsessively data-driven as we scale up.




Based on your previous experience, we expect you to be proactive, continuously optimize the way we work with data and identify new ways to use our data both internally and in our product.




You must:

Have 3+ years of experience analyzing user behavior and funnels inside mobile or web apps.
Have advanced experience with BigQuery or a similar SQL-based data platform, ability to write complex queries from scratch from multiple tables, creating the appropriate joins, extracting and manipulating data, formatting fields, creating new measures and metrics, etc.
Have deep knowledge on business intelligence and data warehousing, and a pulse on data science, data engineering and all aspects of the ETL pipeline.
Understand the typical marketing channels and attribution, especially Google Ads.
Have worked with data from Google Analytics, Firebase or similar platforms.
Have experience with Looker Studio or similar reporting tools.
Be an excellent communicator and data-driven storyteller in spoken as well as written English.
Thrive in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment operating at both strategic and tactical levels with a great attention to detail.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex datasets, and drive business strategy and decision making through partnership across the organization.




We work in English and on-site from our office in Copenhagen with a flexible work from home policy. You will need a Danish work permit for this role.




What we believe in

Vision & mission: We work to eliminate work-life hassles to let people focus on what matters. Today, that means removing the pain and trivial work of handling mileage, while providing peace of mind that nothing is forgotten and all rules are followed.




Product-led: We focus our work on the end-user and optimize for bottom-up adoption. People's use of our product is what leads to our growth. We sell through our product and as self-service. We invest in customer success instead of outbound sales. Our marketing is focused on people with a need, leading them to the product.




Lean & data-driven: We try to get a deep understanding of the problems we‚Äôre solving. But we also acknowledge that we often can‚Äôt predict the outcome of our work. So we believe in an experiment-based approach to product development with short build-measure-learn cycles. For this reason, we also don‚Äôt believe in detailed plans for more than 3 months ahead.




Long-term & compounding: We invest in things with a continuous return and compound. We, e.g., prefer to sell fewer licenses to smaller companies that are a good fit and have a long-term relationship rather than win a ‚Ç¨100k deal with a company that will never actually benefit from our solution. We‚Äôre self-funded, so we don‚Äôt stress about the next funding round and take the time to go into depth with our work.




What we offer

At Driversnote you will be part of an international team composed of talented people that are fun to be around. You will have ample opportunity to influence decisions at all levels, and we hope we can both teach you something and learn something new from you. You‚Äôll get to work with and learn from a team of highly experienced entrepreneurs and tech people. We‚Äôll set aside resources for independent skill development to help you grow and develop your career.




We work in a relaxed environment with new offices near The Meatpacking District. We get a tasty, freshly cooked lunch every day (vegetarian option available), great coffee, cozy Friday drinks, and have great events; from our running club and gaming nights, to our epic Christmas and summer parties.




Since many of us have spouses and kids that we enjoy spending time with, we can honestly say that we offer a healthy work-life balance along with a competitive salary and all the benefits you would expect.




How to apply

Click the button below and complete the application form.




We look forward to hearing from you!




Apply for this position




We accept applications until March 11, 2025. After this, we expect to take a couple of days to review all applications and get back to you no later than March 18. Expect case work during the interview process. The case will be representative of the kind of work you‚Äôll do with us.




For further information or questions, please contact Casper Fabricius at cf@driversnote.com or (+45) 40 50 84 09

Description:
FORSKER MED INTERESSE FOR TV√ÜRSEKTORIELLE SUNDHEDSDATA

Derudover f√•r du til opgave at underst√∏tte den forskning, der allerede foreg√•r i TV√ÜRSPOR. Title: Game Analytics Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily‚Äôs Garden. Now we‚Äôre on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.

With more than 300 talented individuals, we are a mix of over 40 nationalities and 43% women. We truly appreciate the richness of different experiences and perspectives that Tactilers bring to the game. This is why we foster a lean organisational culture, in which each individual is encouraged to take responsibility, be open and grow in their own way. We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

üöÄ Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are in the search for the Lead Game Analyst.

In this key role, you will be responsible for ensuring that the foundation of our data infrastructure for Lily's Garden game is solid and consistent (from as early on as possible), as well as contributing to a broader vision for our game analytics as a whole. You'll lead a team of game analysts, shape the vision for analytics, provide data-driven insights to senior leadership, and drive initiatives to improve processes and solutions across the company.

So if you have prior experience in data analytics, team leadership, along with a big interest in understanding how games work and what makes them successful, then you might just be our missing piece! üß©

This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! We therefore offer full relocation support to those coming from outside of Denmark. Here‚Äôs what you'll do on the day-to-day:


You will uncover insights, identify challenges and opportunities and develop strategies for improving our games
Enhance our capabilities in detailed game analytics and operational reporting by shaping our data stack and platform
Managing one of our talented Data teams
You will be collaborating closely with the rest of the game team to establish, measure and track key metrics for success
Communicating key insights and findings to cross-functional teams
Keeping an up-to-date knowledge of project KPIs
Stay on top of the current industry trends and best practices, applying them where appropriate to enhance product insights capabilities


What we‚Äôre looking for:


Strong background in leading strategic data projects and mentoring a diverse team of data analysts
You have a proven track record of working in a senior capacity with multiple stakeholders in fast paced environments.
You have a strong background in data analytics and a good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and effectively communicate findings to all audiences to drive informed product decisions.
Strong technical skills, with proficiency in SQL and Python or other scripting languages
Experience with large data sets and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:


Experience with casual mobile games and an understanding of today‚Äôs casual mobile games market


What‚Äôs in it for you?

üåÜ Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

ü©∫ Pension and private health insurance

üíª A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

üìö Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

üåÆ Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

ü•≥ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

‚úàÔ∏è Relocation package if you are coming from outside of Denmark

üîç Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: ‚òï Introductory chat with your recruiter to make sure we‚Äôre aligned on the scope of the role and your skillset and to provide more context for you. ü§ù Chat with a Data analytics leadership member. üß™ A test assignment, to see your skills in action. ü§ù In this final step, you‚Äôll be meeting with the team to present your test solutions and discuss the more technical aspects of the role.

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.‚Äç

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! üëã

Title: RGM Analyst, Insights & Development
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you eager to dive into the world of Revenue Growth Management (RGM), using data-driven insights to shape strategic decisions? Do you have a passion for analytics and problem-solving? If so, we invite you to join Pandora, the world‚Äôs largest jewelry brand, in transforming how we drive growth and optimize pricing strategies.

As an RGM Analyst, you‚Äôll play a crucial role in supporting Pandora‚Äôs RGM initiatives. Working closely with the RGM team and cross-functional stakeholders, you‚Äôll analyze data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights that drive revenue growth. This role offers hands-on exposure to cutting-edge tools, global collaborations, and exciting challenges that will accelerate your professional development.

What You‚Äôll Do


Support systematic transformations, including implementing new RGM systems and tools in collaboration with cross-functional partners, incl. D&A partners, local teams and external vendors.
Analyse pricing, promotions, and other commercial and market data to identify growth opportunities.
Lead the development and maintenance of RGM tools and dashboards.
Collaborate with local and global teams to align on RGM & pricing strategies and deliver impactful results.
Create clear, concise reports and presentations that translate complex data into actionable insights.
Contribute to key RGM projects, ensuring timely and high-quality execution.



What We‚Äôre Looking For


1‚Äì4 years of experience in analytics, RGM, pricing, finance, or management consulting.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel; knowledge of Power BI, Alteryx, SQL, or similar tools is a plus.
Detail-oriented mindset and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
A proactive attitude, eagerness to learn, strong commercial instinct and a willingness to embrace new challenges.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate data into clear commercial recommendations.
A curiosity to explore and leverage predictive analytics and AI to optimize commercial planning, pricing, and promotions, driving smarter, data-driven strategies for growth.



What We Offer

At Pandora, you‚Äôll join a global organization that values innovation, collaboration, and personal growth. Based in our Copenhagen Global Office, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate colleagues, tackling impactful projects that drive our business forward. With opportunities to learn and grow, this role will set you up for a successful career in RGM and beyond.

Join Pandora‚Äôs Global Merchandising team and have the chance to shape RGM strategies that drive the future of the company.

Additional Information

Analyst - Global Career Band 5

Limited traveling can be expected.

Application deadline: 28 February 2025

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Patrick Garborg

Global Recruiter

pathr@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Join Pandora‚Äôs Global Merchandising team and have the chance to shape RGM strategies that drive the future of the company.

Additional Information

Analyst - Global Career Band 5

Limited traveling can be expected.

Application deadline: 28 February 2025

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Patrick Garborg

Global Recruiter

pathr@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Student Support - Business Intelligence
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa is part of Siemens Energy, a global leader in energy technology with a rich legacy of innovation spanning over 150 years. Together, we are committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. As a leading player in the wind industry and manufacturer of wind turbines, we are passionate about driving the energy transition and providing innovative solutions that meet the growing energy demand of the global community. At Siemens Gamesa, we are constantly seeking talented individuals to join our team and support our focus on energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Gamesa: Working with us.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

For our Operational Excellence Digital Transformation team in Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy, we are looking for a motivated Student Worker to support our Business Intelligence (BI) initiatives. As part of our team, you will focus on developing, delivering, and maintaining Power BI reporting to help optimize operations in our Aalborg factory.

The duration of this role will be minimum 18 months.

Your Requirements Will Include


Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to support decision-making processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and translate them into BI solutions.
Ensure the quality, accuracy, and reliability of data used in reporting.
Monitor and troubleshoot BI solutions to ensure smooth operation.
Assist in the documentation of BI tools, dashboards, and workflows.
Perform ad hoc tasks as needed to support the team.


What You Need To Make a Difference

Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for someone who is currently enrolled at the university (Bachelor or Master‚Äôs) in Business Administration, Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Computer Science (or similar).

To Be Successful In This Role, You Need/are


Proficient in Power BI and have a solid understanding of data visualization principles.
Knowledge of data modeling concepts is a strong advantage.
Experience with data analysis and ability to interpret data to derive insights.
A structured approach to work, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work with diverse teams.
Fluent in Danish
Advanced English skills, both orally and in writing.


Be aware that we are looking for a candidate, who can attend the office in Aalborg a minimum of 2 times a week.

Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. You have a high professional competency, and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration skills, and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. To thrive in this position, you must have a strong result- and customer-oriented approach.

In return of your commitment, we offer you‚Ä¶

To become a part of our mission for sustainability: clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsidized lunch, employee discounts and much more.

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

#Studentworker

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team via Maia Coombs on maia.coombs.ext@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Please apply in English or Danish via the apply button with your CV and a motivational letter

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Specialist, AI & Data Science
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and passionate Specialist with solid technical experience within the field of AI and Data Science. More specifically, we are looking for a Specialist to join our AI tribe in our office in Copenhagen.

Are you our new Specialist?

As a Specialist within AI and Data Science at Intellishore, you will get the opportunity to be innovative, create lasting impacts for a wide range of customers, and excel in a culture of collaboration.

We are seeking a Specialist with substantial experience in analytics, data engineering, and AI to drive large, technical data science and AI projects and lead technical teams and/or initiatives. You will get to shape and implement technology as well as business solutions to deliver value to our clients across different industries, business areas and technologies. Two projects are rarely the same!

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore is an advanced analytics, AI, and strategy consultancy founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical expertise. Today, we are more than 70 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; data engineering, economics, business, marketing, and data science. We deliver solutions across the value chain - no project is the same, and the energy is high.

We are Intellishorians; a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

What are we looking for in a Specialist?

We Are Looking For An Experienced Individual With The Competencies And Professional Mindset To Be a Tech Lead Within AI And Data Science. If You Meet The Following Attributes, You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


4+ years of experience executing projects within analytics, data engineering, and AI.
Hands-on experience in solution architecture and design, including machine learning models, large language models, and data science solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to translate business objectives into technical requirements.
Excellent communication skills with experience collaborating across technical and non-technical teams.
Experience mentoring and leading technical initiatives is a plus.
It is an advantage if you have experience within the life science industry.



And do not worry about whether you have too much or too little experience. We are always looking for curious and passionate people to join our family, and your title will match your level of seniority and expertise.

What can we offer you?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging project Specialist role in strategic & technical advanced data and AI projects.

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

A highly entrepreneurial work environment with ambitious and innovative colleagues focused on rapidly growing the Intellishore business.

3 | Influence

Unique opportunity for influencing and directing Intellishore‚Äôs market position, commercial growth, and strategic journey.

4 | Strategic seminars

A yearly strategic seminar where all Intellishorians across locations spend time strategizing and team-building (in previous years, we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany). In 2025 we are going to Italy!

5 | Sustainable consulting

A consulting career with high levels of flexibility allowing for work-life balance.

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & AI, and we are constantly expanding our reach.

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the application form. We encourage you to attach a short motivational letter. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sofie.freund@intellishore.dk / +45 71 54 01 08.

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside Europa.
Show more

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside Europa.

Title: Web Analyst (Ecom) - Interim
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Main purpose of the role:

You will be bridging the business with technology, driving strategic programs together with your team and contributing to business optimization and growth by acting as the voice of the customer.

About the Team:

The team you will be joining consists of a Data Analyst, a Business Analyst and a Product Manager, belonging to the Data and Analytics department. We have 2 streams, one heavily engaged with back-end data engineering, and one heavily engaged with Web Analytics, called Tracking. You will mainly drive the Tracking stream.

We work in an agile SAFe set-up with daily Scrum ceremonies, where we together with the engineers discuss progress, hick-ups, blockers etc. It is a very mature, high performing team.

Your Role as a Web Analyst:

You will be gathering business requirements and shaping them into actionable insights. Together with the Global Ecommerce Team and the Digital Squads you will be advising, guiding and consulting the business on most optimal Ecommerce product solutions and optimizations. Combining your technical Web Analytics background with your strong skills in stakeholder management you will not hesitate to challenge status quo.

In addition, you'll be accountable for improving site conversion and customer satisfaction by performing analyzes and consolidating analytical and customers insights, using different tools (Adobe Analytics, Data Layer, Medallia, ContentSquare, Monetate‚Ä¶). Your findings will help to identify customer "pain-points" and improvement opportunities, as well as helping to size potential, actionable opportunities.

Responsibilities:


Translate and document comprehensive functional and non-functional eCommerce requirements and specifications to drive solution design and delivery .
Map current and future state processes, ensuring holistic understanding and optimization, identifying operational pain points and improvements.
Champion effective communication and stakeholder engagement throughout projects.
Create test conditions, drive and participate in testing activities to validate requirements and ensure quality assurance and solution integrity.
Provide hands-on support during project go-live and transition phases.
Work closely with main CX, Digital, eCommerce, Global Marketing, Markets colleagues in order to ensure the collection of business requirements/needs, the setting of the necessary tracks and the analysis of the data collected.



Requirements:


3-5 years of relevant experience in for instance: Web Analytics, Digital Customer Experience, Customer Behaviour, A/B testing, Personalization and/or similar.
Strong analytical skills and data-driven approach with solid commercial experience.
Stakeholder management skills and clear communication.
Familiar with the agile SAFe set-up, working with a back-log and user stories.
Experience with driving strategic programs is preferred.
Understanding of the following tools: Datalayer Strategy, Adobe Analytics, Tealium iQ and Tealium Event Stream is a must.
Be experienced in Web Optimization and Personalization via Monetate or a similar tool, and in Voice Of Customer via Medallia or similar tool.
Understanding basic Javascript coding and tracking management is a plus.
Understanding of key elements that impact digital retail e.g. customer journey management, website personalisation, online merchandising, A/B and multivariate testing, customer segmentation, basket abandonment analysis and competitors benchmarking.



Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora:

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Data Science Intern
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SYBO is part of the Miniclip family and known for the widely popular game, Subway Surfers - the most downloaded mobile game in the world, with over four billion downloads. Located in the heart of Copenhagen, we aim to create playful moments that inspire our fans to care.

We are looking for a talented Data Science Intern to join our Analytics team for 3 to 6 months. During this time, you will get the chance to dive into the exciting world of mobile gaming, to help us enhance our data understanding and innovate within our team.

If you are passionate about data, proactive and have a problem-solving mindset, we would love to have you onboard.

This internship is unpaid and full-time running for the fall semester in 2025.

Your time at SYBO

In your ramp-up month - During this time, you will get the opportunity to experience being part of a real analytics team and your first step will be discovering the gaming industry, SYBO and how our analytics team operates.

In your contributor months - After this discovery period, you will be working a comprehensive investigation into a real gaming data problem with the help of the team. With this project, you will get the opportunity to enhance the game knowledge and provide concrete inputs on how to improve it.

Responsibilities


Your role will lie in applying your analytical skills & creativity to large datasets.
You will be looking for optimisations to contribute to the game performance.
You will get the freedom to propose new ideas, and present them to stakeholders within the company.


Requirements


Experience in a programming language such as Python or R Studio, as well as basics in SQL
Experience with data handling (data collection, cleaning, autonomous exploration etc.)
Understanding of statistical analysis


It is a requirement to be enrolled in a university program that supports a full-time internship as part of the education - and you need to be able to commute to our Copenhagen office on a daily basis.

We do not offer relocation, VISA, or house search assistance for internships.

About SYBO

We're SYBO, the mobile games studio behind the legendary Subway Surfers, with over 4 billion downloads worldwide! Join our team in the heart of Copenhagen, where creativity flourishes in our new, innovative studio.

If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to dive into engaging and creative projects alongside a diverse group of collaborative colleagues from over 40 countries across the globe.

We truly believe you perform your best, when you have the equipment you need - and our IT team is always there to ensure you have access to the latest tools and the right gear, enabling you to be at your best.

We also pride ourselves in taking care of your well-being, offering a delicious lunch buffet, a variety of healthy snacks, and regular social events to keep the energy flowing.

SYBO is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants, regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
Show more
HTML:
SYBO is part of the Miniclip family and known for the widely popular game, Subway Surfers - the most downloaded mobile game in the world, with over four billion downloads. Located in the heart of Copenhagen, we aim to create playful moments that inspire our fans to care.

We are looking for a talented Data Science Intern to join our Analytics team for 3 to 6 months. During this time, you will get the chance to dive into the exciting world of mobile gaming, to help us enhance our data understanding and innovate within our team.

If you are passionate about data, proactive and have a problem-solving mindset, we would love to have you onboard.

This internship is unpaid and full-time running for the fall semester in 2025.

Your time at SYBO

In your ramp-up month - During this time, you will get the opportunity to experience being part of a real analytics team and your first step will be discovering the gaming industry, SYBO and how our analytics team operates.

In your contributor months - After this discovery period, you will be working a comprehensive investigation into a real gaming data problem with the help of the team. With this project, you will get the opportunity to enhance the game knowledge and provide concrete inputs on how to improve it.

Responsibilities

  • Your role will lie in applying your analytical skills & creativity to large datasets.
  • You will be looking for optimisations to contribute to the game performance.
  • You will get the freedom to propose new ideas, and present them to stakeholders within the company.

Requirements

  • Experience in a programming language such as Python or R Studio, as well as basics in SQL
  • Experience with data handling (data collection, cleaning, autonomous exploration etc.)
  • Understanding of statistical analysis

It is a requirement to be enrolled in a university program that supports a full-time internship as part of the education - and you need to be able to commute to our Copenhagen office on a daily basis.

We do not offer relocation, VISA, or house search assistance for internships.

About SYBO

We're SYBO, the mobile games studio behind the legendary Subway Surfers, with over 4 billion downloads worldwide! Join our team in the heart of Copenhagen, where creativity flourishes in our new, innovative studio.

If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to dive into engaging and creative projects alongside a diverse group of collaborative colleagues from over 40 countries across the globe.

We truly believe you perform your best, when you have the equipment you need - and our IT team is always there to ensure you have access to the latest tools and the right gear, enabling you to be at your best.

We also pride ourselves in taking care of your well-being, offering a delicious lunch buffet, a variety of healthy snacks, and regular social events to keep the energy flowing.

SYBO is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants, regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Student Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:‚ÄØ 28564

We are looking for a Student Data Engineer to help build and maintain the next generation of our Data Lakehouse to support our quantitative analysts and traders. This is a part-time opportunity (average 15-20 hours/week) to accommodate your university schedule.

About Our Team

Meet the Investments Engineering team. Our role is to automate and implement trading execution and analytics.

Our team consists of 12 people from 10 different nationalities allocated to different virtual teams co-located in our headquarters in Copenhagen. For this role, you will join an established, cross-disciplinary Value Stream called Investment Agile Development Team (INVADE) where you will work alongside with Software Engineers, Data Engineers, Business Analysts, Quant Analysts and Trading Technology Specialists as part of Trading within Asset & Wealth Management. As a student, you will be paired up with a Data Engineer who will be responsible for mentoring and getting you up to speed.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Main responsibilities in this role:


Developing the INVADE Data Platform, adding new data sources and transformations in response to new business requirements
Continually improving the platform, adopting new technologies and patterns as they become available
Supporting the Trading Quant team by working together to optimize the data model and integrating new sources
Building internal tooling to support both development as well as the Trading Quant team
Continue migrating the existing platform into our Lakehouse


Who You Are

This is the right role for you if you:


Have a passion for technology and data
Are a good communicator, ready to collaborate on various stages of software development and data engineering
Are able to learn on your feet, and are interested in exploring better ways of working
Care about good software practices such as SOLID, ‚ÄúEverything-as-code‚Äù, automated testing etc.


Your background and skills include:


Experience working with Python in a data engineering capacity
Experience with SQL
Experience with shell and Unix/Linux environments


It would be ideal if you also:


Worked with Docker
Have experience with building CI/CD pipelines
Familiarity with AWS or other public cloud
Have experience with building dashboards and python APIs


What We Offer‚ÄØ

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it‚Äôs to take their career to the next level. For others, it‚Äôs to break new ground within their area of expertise ‚Äì in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model ‚Äì we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!‚ÄØ

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 22/02/2025.‚ÄØFor more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Anders Bogsnes at anders.bogsnes@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do ‚Äì when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers‚Äô needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We‚Äôre more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you‚Äôre solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst til arbejdet med data p√• tv√¶rs af organisationen
Place: Hiller√∏d, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du v√¶re med til at udvikle datal√∏sninger, der sikrer effektive arbejdsgange p√• tv√¶rs af organisationen og underst√∏tter strategiske beslutninger i toppen? S√• er du m√•ske den Data Analyst, vi s√∏ger i Koncern√∏konomi og Styring.




Kan du sikre h√∏j kvalitet i datal√∏sninger?




Som Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst arbejder du med data t√¶t p√• ledelsen og direktionen i ATP. Du skal udvikle, vedligeholde og optimere datastrukturer og skabeloner og sikre h√∏j datakvalitet i forretningskritisk data p√• tv√¶rs af ATP.




Vi leder efter dig, der har indsigt i, hvordan data underst√∏tter forretningsprocesser, og som kan samarbejde med interessenter i b√•de it og forretning for at underst√∏tte datadrevne beslutninger.




Du kommer til at arbejde med at forbedre vores datainfrastruktur og udvikle skabeloner, der sikrer ensartet rapportering. En vigtig del af dine opgaver bliver at g√∏re data nemt tilg√¶ngelige og transparente for organisationen. Samtidig vil du sikre, at vores BI-processer og datastruktur arbejder optimalt sammen og styrker samarbejdet p√• tv√¶rs af afdelinger.




Du f√•r en rolle, hvor du er med til at definere, hvordan vi arbejder med √∏konomi- og HR-data, og hvordan vi l√∏bende kan udvikle med andre datakilder eller former for oplysninger, som kan berige det grundlag, medarbejdere og ledelsen i ATP foretager beslutninger p√• baggrund af.




Mere konkret bliver dine opgaver at:




strukturere og dokumentere SAP-data og oprette rapporteringsskabeloner, s√• vores rapporter bliver ensartede
sikre tilg√¶ngeligt og anvendeligt data for vores interne kunder p√• tv√¶rs af it, √∏konomi og HR
bidrage til en f√¶lles datastruktur, der bliver koblet sammen med de BI-processer, der er og kommer
udbrede brug af data p√• tv√¶rs af Corporate Functions, s√• vi sikrer sammenh√¶ng i vores √∏konomiske rapportering.




Br√¶nder du for at skabe indsigt gennem data?




Der er mange veje til stillingen som Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst, men vi forestiller os, at du har en mellem til lang videreg√•ende uddannelse og gerne et par √•rs erhvervserfaring, der er relevant til stillingen. Alternativt er du nyuddannet med en kandidatgrad og kan f√• en plads i ATP‚Äôs graudateprogram.




Vi leder efter dig, der har teknisk indsigt, men ogs√• evner at forst√•, hvordan datadrevne l√∏sninger kan skabe reel v√¶rdi for forretningen.




Derudover t√¶nker vi, at du har:




erfaring med projekt- eller konsulentarbejde
erfaring med BI-relateret arbejde, gerne i en finansfunktion
kendskab til SAP og M365 Microsoft-pakken
evnen til at kommunikere komplekse og tekniske emner til b√•de tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.




Vi stiller h√∏je krav til din faglighed, og du vil blive m√∏dt af en forventning med at tage ansvar, stille sp√∏rgsm√•l og udvikle dig selv og de f√¶llesskaber, du bliver en del af. Vi ved nemlig, at engagerede medarbejdere er altafg√∏rende for, at vi n√•r vores m√•l og bliver ved med at v√¶re de bedste til at l√∏se vigtige samfundsopgaver.




Vil du v√¶re en del af et unikt fagligt f√¶llesskab?




I Koncern√∏konomi og Styring ser vi frem til at f√• dig med p√• holdet i en afdeling, hvor vi samlet set er mere end 70 medarbejdere, der arbejder med alle aspekter inden for data, som bruges i den daglige drift og udvikling af en stor koncern som ATP.




I teamet er vi 6 digitaliserings-, data- og BI-specialister, og du bliver den syvende. Vi har stor ber√∏ringsflade p√• tv√¶rs af Corporate Functions, og vi g√∏r os umage med den rapportering, vi laver, fordi den skaber stor v√¶rdi for ledelsen og resten af vores kolleger.




Du bliver del af et team, hvor vi er forskellige b√•de fagligt og personligt, men hvor vi er gode til at sparre med og inspirere hinanden fagligt. Det er vigtigt for os, at vi m√∏der hinanden med gensidig respekt og rummelighed, og at vi lykkedes med vores opgaver rettidigt og i en god kvalitet.




I ATP er barren sat h√∏jt, b√•de n√•r det g√¶lder ambitioner og trivsel. Vi tror p√• et arbejdsliv i balance. Det kr√¶ver fleksibilitet med plads til den enkelte - og det har vi.




=dig? S√• send os dit CV




Du beh√∏ver ikke sende os en lang ans√∏gning. Vi er mere interesserede i dit CV, som du skal sende senest den 16. februar. N√•r du sender dit CV via vores system, f√•r du mulighed for kort at beskrive din motivation for at s√∏ge stillingen.




I ATP arbejder vi for en fair rekrutteringsproces, og derfor beder vi dig om ikke at vedh√¶fte billede i dit CV eller angive din alder, n√•r du s√∏ger.




Vi behandler henvendelser l√∏bende og h√•ber p√• opstart hurtigst muligt. Du kan l√¶se mere om rekrutteringsforl√∏bet her.




Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Louise L√∏ve Langhorm p√• tlf. 20 49 68 28 eller mail lll@atp.dk.

Vi leder efter dig, der har teknisk indsigt, men ogs√• evner at forst√•, hvordan datadrevne l√∏sninger kan skabe reel v√¶rdi for forretningen.


Derudover t√¶nker vi, at du har:


  • erfaring med projekt- eller konsulentarbejde
  • erfaring med BI-relateret arbejde, gerne i en finansfunktion
  • kendskab til SAP og M365 Microsoft-pakken
  • evnen til at kommunikere komplekse og tekniske emner til b√•de tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.


Vi stiller h√∏je krav til din faglighed, og du vil blive m√∏dt af en forventning med at tage ansvar, stille sp√∏rgsm√•l og udvikle dig selv og de f√¶llesskaber, du bliver en del af. Vi ved nemlig, at engagerede medarbejdere er altafg√∏rende for, at vi n√•r vores m√•l og bliver ved med at v√¶re de bedste til at l√∏se vigtige samfundsopgaver.


Vil du v√¶re en del af et unikt fagligt f√¶llesskab?


I Koncern√∏konomi og Styring ser vi frem til at f√• dig med p√• holdet i en afdeling, hvor vi samlet set er mere end 70 medarbejdere, der arbejder med alle aspekter inden for data, som bruges i den daglige drift og udvikling af en stor koncern som ATP.


I teamet er vi 6 digitaliserings-, data- og BI-specialister, og du bliver den syvende. Vi har stor ber√∏ringsflade p√• tv√¶rs af Corporate Functions, og vi g√∏r os umage med den rapportering, vi laver, fordi den skaber stor v√¶rdi for ledelsen og resten af vores kolleger.


Du bliver del af et team, hvor vi er forskellige b√•de fagligt og personligt, men hvor vi er gode til at sparre med og inspirere hinanden fagligt. Det er vigtigt for os, at vi m√∏der hinanden med gensidig respekt og rummelighed, og at vi lykkedes med vores opgaver rettidigt og i en god kvalitet.


I ATP er barren sat h√∏jt, b√•de n√•r det g√¶lder ambitioner og trivsel. Vi tror p√• et arbejdsliv i balance. Det kr√¶ver fleksibilitet med plads til den enkelte - og det har vi.


=dig? S√• send os dit CV


Du beh√∏ver ikke sende os en lang ans√∏gning. Vi er mere interesserede i dit CV, som du skal sende senest den 16. februar. N√•r du sender dit CV via vores system, f√•r du mulighed for kort at beskrive din motivation for at s√∏ge stillingen.


I ATP arbejder vi for en fair rekrutteringsproces, og derfor beder vi dig om ikke at vedh√¶fte billede i dit CV eller angive din alder, n√•r du s√∏ger.


Vi behandler henvendelser l√∏bende og h√•ber p√• opstart hurtigst muligt. Du kan l√¶se mere om rekrutteringsforl√∏bet her.


Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Louise L√∏ve Langhorm p√• tlf. 20 49 68 28 eller mail lll@atp.dk.

Title: Azure l√∏sningsarkitekt
Place: Denmark
Description:
Vil du gribe en sp√¶ndende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Br√¶nder du for at kommunikere den v√¶rdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilf√∏re vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hj√¶lper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: S√∏borg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure l√∏sningsarkitekt, vil du p√• baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og r√•dgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services v√¶rdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil v√¶re at drive pre-sales, definere og afgr√¶nse, designe og optimere Azure-l√∏sninger, samt udf√∏re problemfri implementering og udrulning p√• tv√¶rs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsomr√•der:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe l√∏nsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsomr√•der, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne st√∏tte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, pr√¶sentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ √•rs relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og r√•dgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udf√∏relse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-l√∏sninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere l√∏sninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafh√¶ngig, vedholdende og drevet til at forf√∏lge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du r√•dgiver om teknologiens indvirkning p√• kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at s√¶tte personlige m√•l og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at n√• team- og forretningsm√•l
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage f√∏ringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder ogs√•;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse p√• hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden f√∏lger ‚Äôthe new normal policy‚Äô, som er 2-3 dage p√• kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra ‚Äì vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i k√∏leskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om √•ret ‚Äì vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens f√∏rende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skr√¶ddersyende l√∏sninger indenfor softwareleverand√∏rstyring p√• tv√¶rs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. ‚Äì alts√• nogle af de st√∏rste navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en b√∏rsnoteret koncern, som globalt besk√¶ftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere p√• vores kontorer p√• tv√¶rs af landegr√¶nserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt p√• 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i S√∏borg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk milj√∏, hvor vi har en meget √•ben og hj√¶lpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er st√¶rkt drevet af at g√∏re en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer ‚Äì og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt s√¶rligt ‚Äì og det er det vi elsker ved at v√¶re medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.
