Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 24876

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating a new cloud environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of near real time data ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you‚Äôll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea¬¥s target payment architecture.

What you‚Äôll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset ‚Äì actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/03/2025. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

Title: Business Intelligence Partner
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a proud data enthusiast with a keen business sense? We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Partner to join our Finance, Legal & Data team‚Äîsomeone who thrives on turning complex data into meaningful insights that drive real impact. If you love building dashboards, solving data challenges, and empowering teams with reliable, actionable information, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




What excites you:

You want to make a difference. You see the bigger picture and know how to connect the dots between data and business strategy. You‚Äôre passionate about building dashboards, owning data models, and shaping how a company makes data-driven decisions. Your work will influence teams across Famly, giving them the tools and insights they need to succeed.




What excites us:

You are a technical wizard. Your understanding of data and proficiency in SQL gives us goosebumps, and your excellence at translating data into insights that drive value and impact, is the cherry on top. You work across teams, interacting with various stakeholders to achieve shared goals. You listen well and are a strong communicator, whether it‚Äôs a detailed report or an executive summary, you can make complex data accessible and actionable for any audience. You‚Äôre not just here to follow instructions‚Äîyou‚Äôre proactive, resourceful, and excited about driving improvements and leading projects, and you take ownership over your tasks, are able to step back to see the full picture, being a source of truth on analyses.




What you‚Äôll be doing:

Building dashboards: Develop and maintain easy-to-use dashboards that provide real insights for leadership, managers, and individual teams. We‚Äôre focusing on leadership dashboards in the short term, with plans to expand into personal dashboards and OKR integration later in the year.
Owning Data Integrity: Act as the company‚Äôs data steward, ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and consistency of data across all systems. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies to maintain a trusted source of truth
Driving Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with teams across departments to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that optimize processes and drive better outcomes. Lead projects that address underlying data challenges, coordinating with stakeholders to implement sustainable fixes.
Delivering Insights: Provide actionable insights and analytics to enable smarter, data-driven decision-making across the organization. Implement feedback loops to refine dashboards and ensure they evolve with the company‚Äôs needs.
Promoting Data Literacy: Champion a culture of data-driven decision-making by educating teams and empowering them to integrate data into their strategies.




What you bring to the role:

SQL Mastery: You‚Äôre highly skilled in querying and managing data with SQL.
Developer knowledge: You know your way around Github or other modern version control systems
Data Visualization Knowledge: You understand the best practices for creating dashboards that are both intuitive and impactful.
Systems Savvy: You have a high level of systems intuition, quickly grasping complex data landscapes.
Cross-Functional Understanding: You can work effectively with diverse teams to identify needs and deliver insights that matter.
Great communication skills: You can break down complex data concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Bonus Points: If you have experience developing small API integrations or connecting systems, we‚Äôll be even more impressed.




About you:

You‚Äôre a proactive results-driven problem solver. You don‚Äôt wait for issues to arise‚Äîyou anticipate them and act.
You‚Äôre meticulous, ensuring data accuracy and consistency in every project.
You thrive on teamwork and enjoy building relationships across departments.
You‚Äôre curious & adaptable, always learning and are comfortable navigating a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
You are the data champion! You‚Äôre passionate about fostering data literacy and empowering others to make informed decisions.
You‚Äôre a self-starter and when faced with new tools, you don‚Äôt shy away, but roll up your sleeves and learn.

We appreciate that everyone brings something unique, so even if you don‚Äôt tick every box above, we‚Äôd still love to read your application.




And Famly are...? ‚Ä¶ you wonder

At Famly, we are committed to giving children the best possible start in life and support them in the essential work that is necessary to achieve this. To this end, we have been developing a holistic digital solution since 2013 that simplifies workflows and makes everyday daycare life easier for educators and parents.

These days, the 170 of us building Famly are trying to do two things for our 6,300 customers:

Giving children the best possible start to life.
Championing the vital work that goes into making that happen.

We do that with software that brings hundreds of thousands of parents closer to their child‚Äôs day while they‚Äôre away from them. We also make financial, pedagogical, and planning tools for more than 34,000 childcare professionals, saving them hours and reducing their admin stress. Ultimately, that gives them more time and headspace for the little ones that really matter. Come help us make that happen.




You‚Äôll love working here because:

We‚Äôre all about hiring clever people who are good humans too. It means Famly is full of top thinkers and generous teammates waiting to help you shine.
We like to give a lot of ownership both in terms of responsibility and freedom to try new things. We‚Äôll get you up and running and collaborate along the way, of course.
A value of ‚Äòmake your colleagues shine‚Äô is all about breaking down silos, celebrating one another, and staying connected across departments, offices, and oceans.
Top-notch work equipment (including noise cancelling headphones for those focus periods!).
A big focus on people support with personal and career development, including leadership training in a wide-variety of topics.




Interested? Let us know! We're looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so get your application in today by sending us:

Your CV
A cover letter, in which you tell us about yourself and why you‚Äôre the best person for this position.




This is what our interview process looks like:

Video conversation with Senior People Partner
Logical test
On-site interview with the Senior Director of Finance & Legal, which will include completing a skills test




We look forward to hearing from you!







Famly is committed to creating a more diverse, equal, and inclusive workforce, building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. It is a fundamental policy at Famly not to discriminate on any basis or characteristics and celebrate diversity. Everyone is welcome and encouraged to apply.

Show more
HTML:
Are you a proud data enthusiast with a keen business sense? We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Partner to join our Finance, Legal & Data team‚Äîsomeone who thrives on turning complex data into meaningful insights that drive real impact. If you love building dashboards, solving data challenges, and empowering teams with reliable, actionable information, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.


What excites you:

You want to make a difference. You see the bigger picture and know how to connect the dots between data and business strategy. You‚Äôre passionate about building dashboards, owning data models, and shaping how a company makes data-driven decisions. Your work will influence teams across Famly, giving them the tools and insights they need to succeed.


What excites us:

You are a technical wizard. Your understanding of data and proficiency in SQL gives us goosebumps, and your excellence at translating data into insights that drive value and impact, is the cherry on top. You work across teams, interacting with various stakeholders to achieve shared goals. You listen well and are a strong communicator, whether it‚Äôs a detailed report or an executive summary, you can make complex data accessible and actionable for any audience. You‚Äôre not just here to follow instructions‚Äîyou‚Äôre proactive, resourceful, and excited about driving improvements and leading projects, and you take ownership over your tasks, are able to step back to see the full picture, being a source of truth on analyses.


What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Building dashboards: Develop and maintain easy-to-use dashboards that provide real insights for leadership, managers, and individual teams. We‚Äôre focusing on leadership dashboards in the short term, with plans to expand into personal dashboards and OKR integration later in the year.
  • Owning Data Integrity: Act as the company‚Äôs data steward, ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and consistency of data across all systems. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies to maintain a trusted source of truth
  • Driving Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with teams across departments to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that optimize processes and drive better outcomes. Lead projects that address underlying data challenges, coordinating with stakeholders to implement sustainable fixes.
  • Delivering Insights: Provide actionable insights and analytics to enable smarter, data-driven decision-making across the organization. Implement feedback loops to refine dashboards and ensure they evolve with the company‚Äôs needs.
  • Promoting Data Literacy: Champion a culture of data-driven decision-making by educating teams and empowering them to integrate data into their strategies.


What you bring to the role:

  • SQL Mastery: You‚Äôre highly skilled in querying and managing data with SQL.
  • Developer knowledge: You know your way around Github or other modern version control systems
  • Data Visualization Knowledge: You understand the best practices for creating dashboards that are both intuitive and impactful.
  • Systems Savvy: You have a high level of systems intuition, quickly grasping complex data landscapes.
  • Cross-Functional Understanding: You can work effectively with diverse teams to identify needs and deliver insights that matter.
  • Great communication skills: You can break down complex data concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Bonus Points: If you have experience developing small API integrations or connecting systems, we‚Äôll be even more impressed.


About you:

  • You‚Äôre a proactive results-driven problem solver. You don‚Äôt wait for issues to arise‚Äîyou anticipate them and act.
  • You‚Äôre meticulous, ensuring data accuracy and consistency in every project.
  • You thrive on teamwork and enjoy building relationships across departments.
  • You‚Äôre curious & adaptable, always learning and are comfortable navigating a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • You are the data champion! You‚Äôre passionate about fostering data literacy and empowering others to make informed decisions.
  • You‚Äôre a self-starter and when faced with new tools, you don‚Äôt shy away, but roll up your sleeves and learn.

We appreciate that everyone brings something unique, so even if you don‚Äôt tick every box above, we‚Äôd still love to read your application.


And Famly are...? ‚Ä¶ you wonder

At Famly, we are committed to giving children the best possible start in life and support them in the essential work that is necessary to achieve this. To this end, we have been developing a holistic digital solution since 2013 that simplifies workflows and makes everyday daycare life easier for educators and parents.

These days, the 170 of us building Famly are trying to do two things for our 6,300 customers:

  • Giving children the best possible start to life.
  • Championing the vital work that goes into making that happen.

We do that with software that brings hundreds of thousands of parents closer to their child‚Äôs day while they‚Äôre away from them. We also make financial, pedagogical, and planning tools for more than 34,000 childcare professionals, saving them hours and reducing their admin stress. Ultimately, that gives them more time and headspace for the little ones that really matter. Come help us make that happen.


You‚Äôll love working here because:

  • We‚Äôre all about hiring clever people who are good humans too. It means Famly is full of top thinkers and generous teammates waiting to help you shine.
  • We like to give a lot of ownership both in terms of responsibility and freedom to try new things. We‚Äôll get you up and running and collaborate along the way, of course.
  • A value of ‚Äòmake your colleagues shine‚Äô is all about breaking down silos, celebrating one another, and staying connected across departments, offices, and oceans.
  • Top-notch work equipment (including noise cancelling headphones for those focus periods!).
  • A big focus on people support with personal and career development, including leadership training in a wide-variety of topics.


Interested? Let us know! We're looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so get your application in today by sending us:

  • Your CV
  • A cover letter, in which you tell us about yourself and why you‚Äôre the best person for this position.


This is what our interview process looks like:

  • Video conversation with Senior People Partner
  • Logical test
  • On-site interview with the Senior Director of Finance & Legal, which will include completing a skills test


We look forward to hearing from you!



Famly is committed to creating a more diverse, equal, and inclusive workforce, building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. It is a fundamental policy at Famly not to discriminate on any basis or characteristics and celebrate diversity. Everyone is welcome and encouraged to apply.

Title: Quantitative Analyst for US Trading Team
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new‚ÄØQuantitative Analyst for US Trading

At MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and drive the green transition.

We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious US Power Trading team. This is your opportunity to play a key role in the dynamic and evolving US power market, working alongside talented traders and analysts who share your drive for excellence and innovation.

Why join us?

At MFT Energy, we combine a startup mindset with the strength of a global organization. We believe in empowering individuals to make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurial thinking are the cornerstones of our success.

As a quantitative analyst in MFT, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our US power trading team, which specializes in navigating one of the world‚Äôs most complex and fast-moving energy markets.

Here‚Äôs What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Modelling: Build Mathematical models to support trading strategies
Data infrastructure: Enhance and streamline data pipelines, ensuring robust analytics and efficient operations.
Team collaboration: Work closely with traders and analysts to translate market insights into actionable tools and models.
Innovation: Research and implement new technologies and methodologies to stay ahead in energy market modeling and analytics.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Master‚Äôs or PhD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or another quantitative field.
Proficiency in Python and a statically typed programming language.
Experience designing and maintaining reliable, automated systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills preferable with strong knowledge of Statistics.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


You should expect technical tests as part of the recruitment process.

Our ideal candidate

You thrive in high-pressure environments. You have a desire to solve complex problems optimally from the ground up with next level curiosity. Furthermore, it's an expectation that the candidate is passionate about stock markets, gaming, betting, science fiction, manga or similar (passion being the keyword).

What We Offer


A dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment where the best ideas win.
Talented and ambitious colleagues who challenge and support you.
Competitive benefits and a people-first leadership approach.
Mind boggling daily lunch conversations (e.g. physicists explaining space-time and Schr√∂dinger's cat or lectures on differences between wizards and sorcerers).


Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations - Please send us the following information: your CV, a link to your GitHub or other passion projects examples, your grades, and answers to the four questions in the application form. No cover letter needed.

For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Start date: As soon as possible

We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

We are a global and independent energy trading hub specializing in power and gas, trading 24/7 across 40 countries. With MFT Energy's unique partner model, we empower entrepreneurs to become the best and make the most of their talent. We believe the most successful way to advance our business is to extend a sense of ownership to as many employees as possible.

Flydende kundskaber i engelsk, b√•de mundtligt og skriftligt.




Kinnerton tilbyder:

Om Kinnerton Capital

Kinnerton er en investeringsvirksomhed, grundlagt i 2010, og som har specialiseret sig dels i kapital/investering og dels i kreditfinansiering til investorer i det nordiske real estate marked.

Deres investeringsstrategi er baseret p√• dybdeg√•ende markedsresearch og analyser.




P√• grund af den specialiserede karakter af Kinnertons strategier oplever virksomheden begr√¶nset konkurrence, hvilket resulterer i attraktive afkast for investorerne.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SOUNDBOKS is an innovative audio tech company and aspiring lifestyle brand. You may have seen us at a music festival, at your favourite sport event or at your friend‚Äôs celebration (this is our nice way of saying nightclub-level private event). We create the loudest, most durable, and arguably coolest Bluetooth speakers on the market.

Growth is not something we offer, it‚Äôs who we are. Learning is at the centre of everything, people will teach you what they know and the involvement is yours to take. We‚Äôre talking a real-time & on-the-job learning, and it‚Äôs our ultimate goal that you leave the office everyday having learned something new.

With 90 team members in Denmark and the United States, SOUNDBOKS is equal parts seasoned professionals and passionate unconventionals. We‚Äôve got an amazing thing going, and it‚Äôs only getting better!

ROLE DATA ANALYTICS ENGINEER

TEAM DATA, INFRASTRUCTURE, AND OPTIMIZATION

HOURS FULL TIME

LOCATION COPENHAGEN

START DATE APRIL 2025

The Data, Infrastructure, and Optimization Team is responsible for building and maintaining data products and enabling new insights for better decision-making, objective setting, and monitoring within SOUNDBOKS. The team is also in charge of analyzing and automating processes that are key to increasing the company's efficiency.

As the Data Analytics Engineer, you‚Äôll drive the process of scoping, clarifying, and implementing solutions for the data and reporting needs that will have a real impact on the business. You'll strengthen and scale our technical data foundation, ensuring teams across the company can consistently unlock insights that drive our growth.

Okay, let‚Äôs make things a little more concrete. Here‚Äôs what we expect your daily life to look like:

Driving Impactful Data Solutions


You‚Äôll scope, drive, and implement solutions for data and reporting needs with real impact on business operations and productivity.
You‚Äôll gain an understanding of stakeholders‚Äô processes to capture and clarify data requirements in collaboration with department specialists.
You‚Äôll create new reports and data solutions in Power BI and make them available for relevant stakeholders to access and make use of.



Building, Managing & Refining Data Systems


You‚Äôll integrate new data sources and automations (Weld).
You‚Äôll continuously create and improve data models in Databricks using PySpark.
You‚Äôll co-own and maintain the code, data models, pipelines, and the release process.
You‚Äôll hold ownership to maintain and manage the Power BI platform.
You‚Äôll carry out measures that improve data quality and governance.



Enabling Growth & Efficiency


You‚Äôll actively help other teams become more efficient in their work.
You‚Äôll take on initiatives to mature and refine the data function.



In order to become a success in this role, we believe that your profile should be aligned with the bullets listed below. However, we acknowledge that success can take many forms, so please do apply even if you don‚Äôt tick all the boxes.


You have 3 or more years of experience in working with Data Engineering or a related role.
You‚Äôre skilled in SQL, Python (PySpark to be exact) and a data warehousing (preferably via Databricks).
You carry solid knowledge in AWS (Amazon Web Services), Google Cloud, or another cloud service provider.
You‚Äôve definitely worked with a visualization tool before - ideally PowerBI, but it might have also been Tableau, Looker or other.
You know how to work with Git for version control and GitHub for collaboration.
You‚Äôre skilled in getting insights from stakeholders on how particular dashboards are used, which then allows you to structure them in a user-friendly way.
Ideally, you‚Äôve worked with a business whose data functions cover areas such as e-commerce, marketing, supply chain, finance, or a combination of them.
You‚Äôve got the know-how to move a project from start to finish, making sure everything‚Äôs in place for success.
With your open and proactive communication, you‚Äôre good at building trust and rapport with the people you work with.



Intrigued? At SOUNDBOKS you‚Äôll find yourself a part of a community. We realize that growth is a process and we don‚Äôt expect you to go through it alone. Actually, we guarantee that you won‚Äôt have to. We work together in order to work smarter, we inspire each other to be better, and we never forget that every member of the team is responsible for our success.

So, if you‚Äôre tired of all of the noise in the job market, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. This may be the coolest job you ever have!

START DATE APRIL 2025

The Data, Infrastructure, and Optimization Team is responsible for building and maintaining data products and enabling new insights for better decision-making, objective setting, and monitoring within SOUNDBOKS. The team is also in charge of analyzing and automating processes that are key to increasing the company's efficiency.

As the Data Analytics Engineer, you‚Äôll drive the process of scoping, clarifying, and implementing solutions for the data and reporting needs that will have a real impact on the business. You'll strengthen and scale our technical data foundation, ensuring teams across the company can consistently unlock insights that drive our growth.

Okay, let‚Äôs make things a little more concrete. Here‚Äôs what we expect your daily life to look like:

Driving Impactful Data Solutions

  • You‚Äôll scope, drive, and implement solutions for data and reporting needs with real impact on business operations and productivity.
  • You‚Äôll gain an understanding of stakeholders‚Äô processes to capture and clarify data requirements in collaboration with department specialists.
  • You‚Äôll create new reports and data solutions in Power BI and make them available for relevant stakeholders to access and make use of.


Building, Managing & Refining Data Systems

  • You‚Äôll integrate new data sources and automations (Weld).
  • You‚Äôll continuously create and improve data models in Databricks using PySpark.
  • You‚Äôll co-own and maintain the code, data models, pipelines, and the release process.
  • You‚Äôll hold ownership to maintain and manage the Power BI platform.
  • You‚Äôll carry out measures that improve data quality and governance.


Enabling Growth & Efficiency

  • You‚Äôll actively help other teams become more efficient in their work.
  • You‚Äôll take on initiatives to mature and refine the data function.


In order to become a success in this role, we believe that your profile should be aligned with the bullets listed below. However, we acknowledge that success can take many forms, so please do apply even if you don‚Äôt tick all the boxes.

  • You have 3 or more years of experience in working with Data Engineering or a related role.
  • You‚Äôre skilled in SQL, Python (PySpark to be exact) and a data warehousing (preferably via Databricks).
  • You carry solid knowledge in AWS (Amazon Web Services), Google Cloud, or another cloud service provider.
  • You‚Äôve definitely worked with a visualization tool before - ideally PowerBI, but it might have also been Tableau, Looker or other.
  • You know how to work with Git for version control and GitHub for collaboration.
  • You‚Äôre skilled in getting insights from stakeholders on how particular dashboards are used, which then allows you to structure them in a user-friendly way.
  • Ideally, you‚Äôve worked with a business whose data functions cover areas such as e-commerce, marketing, supply chain, finance, or a combination of them.
  • You‚Äôve got the know-how to move a project from start to finish, making sure everything‚Äôs in place for success.
  • With your open and proactive communication, you‚Äôre good at building trust and rapport with the people you work with.


Intrigued? At SOUNDBOKS you‚Äôll find yourself a part of a community. We realize that growth is a process and we don‚Äôt expect you to go through it alone. Actually, we guarantee that you won‚Äôt have to. We work together in order to work smarter, we inspire each other to be better, and we never forget that every member of the team is responsible for our success.

So, if you‚Äôre tired of all of the noise in the job market, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. This may be the coolest job you ever have!

Title: Data Driven Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Metropolitan Area
Description:
Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for reporting and data modeling, eager to join a fast-growing company in the financial sector? Do you envision creating an innovative reporting universe that empowers our users and strengthens decision-making? If so, we would love to hear from you!




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 600 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide. We are a differentiator in the market who provides the stability of a Bank and the flexibility of a Fintech, to deliver a payments solution to our clients as we continue transforming the Banking and Payments industry for the new economy.




About the role

We are looking to hire a Business Analyst, in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Implementation Team Lead.




In this role, you will work closely with colleagues across the bank to further develop and enhance our Data Platform and Power BI reporting universe. Most importantly, you will help empower our users through enhancing user experience and strengthen decision-making by producing quality reports and developing high standard data models. In some cases, you will also work with data engineers, translating business requirements into actionable technical specifications for the data engineers to implement.




What you will be doing

Gather reporting use cases with various internal stakeholders. Collaborate with the team to prioritize and implement the use cases that delivers the highest value.
Maintain and further develop data models to accommodate evolving business needs. This includes maintaining the data dictionary.
Ensure reports remain relevant by incorporating feedback from users.
Testing and validating as part of the development life cycle.
Perform root cause analysis on data issues and ensure follow up with data owners.




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you have demonstrated experience in delivering reporting solutions - ideally within the financial sector or as a consultant - you thrive on translating demands into practical, user-centered outcomes.

You have experience in building high-quality reports, with Power BI being a plus, and a strong interest or proficiency in data modelling with SQL. It is an advantage if you are familiar with tools like Data Build Tool (dbt) and Databricks. Knowledge of data warehousing processes and principles will be an advantage.




As a person you are highly collaborative with strong communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with users, data engineers and other stakeholders. You have an analytical mindset, can navigate complex data structures and like to challenge things to find ways to continuously improve traditional solutions.




As Banking Circle is an international company it¬¥s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity. However, we do expect you to spend most of your time in the office to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible.

Please note that applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.




If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Svetlana Stetchi, Global Recruitment Partner, on svst@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world‚Äôs clearing systems ‚Äì enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: Student Worker - Data Analyst
Place: Brande, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa is part of Siemens Energy, a global leader in energy technology with a rich legacy of innovation spanning over 150 years. Together, we are committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. As a leading player in the wind industry and manufacturer of wind turbines, we are passionate about driving the energy transition and providing innovative solutions that meet the growing energy demand of the global community. At Siemens Gamesa, we are constantly seeking talented individuals to join our team and support our focus on energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Gamesa: Working with us.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

We are looking for a self-driven student worker to support our Business Controlling Technology department in Brande.

Being a Student Worker in Siemens Gamesa is an opportunity for you to develop your personal capabilities and build a professional and international network. You will get the chance to enhance your professional development and get relevant work experience in a global company.

Your Responsibilities Will Consist Of


Managing & analyzing data
The tasks will also vary depending on your previous experience as well as how long you will be staying


What You Need To Make a Difference

Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for someone who is currently enrolled at the university (bachelor or master‚Äôs) in Business Administration, Economics, Information Technology, Technology Based Business Development, Engineering (or similar). If you already have some experience with logistic work from a previous job, it is considered a huge advantage.

To Be Successful In This Role, You Need/are


Working knowledge using Microsoft Office Tools, especially Excel, Power BI is important
Additional system knowledge within SAP and Teamcenter is preferred
An understanding about data work & management
A good communicator who feels comfortable reaching out to multiple stakeholders
Excellent English skills, both written & spoken
Proactive & have a can-do attitude
A team player who thrives in a multicultural team
Able to perform work individually (with guidance when required)
Able to take responsibility for the work, which you deliver


Beware, we are looking for a student, who can come into the office in around 1-2 times a week, and more in the beginning.

Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. You have a high professional competency, and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration skills, and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. To thrive in this position, you must have a strong result- and customer-oriented approach.

In return of your commitment, we offer you‚Ä¶

To become a part of our mission for sustainability: clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsidized lunch, employee discounts and much more.

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

#Studentworker

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team via Maia Coombs on maia.coombs.ext@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Please apply in English via the apply button with your CV and a motivational letter

For more information about working in Denmark, please see this link: https://www.siemensgamesa.com/explore/journal/wind-engineers-in-denmark

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Join us, be part of more.

We‚Äôre so much more than an energy company. We‚Äôre a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that‚Äôs energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn‚Äôt rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That‚Äôs why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently ‚Äì we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

About your team:

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We‚Äôre energy movers by nature. We‚Äôre a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use ‚Äì powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team‚Äôs model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we‚Äôre looking for:


Master‚Äôs Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We‚Äôre not a perfect place ‚Äì but we‚Äôre a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we‚Äôre a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

Title: (Senior) Quantitative Analyst
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
About Odigo Energy

Odigo Energy is a newly founded energy trading company headquartered in Aarhus. Our team of experienced traders, data scientists, and software developers is building a state-of-the-art trading infrastructure to drive innovation in the energy markets. With a growing team of six full-time employees and one student assistant, we are now looking for the right talent to expand our algorithmic trading activities.

¬†

Role Overview

We are seeking a skilled professional with experience in the energy industry, preferably in short-term power trading, to join our team. The ideal candidate is proficient in Python and has hands-on experience in developing algorithmic trading strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work at the intersection of trading, quantitative analytics, and technology, contributing to the development of cutting-edge trading strategies.

¬†

Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize algorithmic trading strategies for energy markets
Apply quantitative models to analyze market dynamics and trading opportunities
Work closely with traders, data scientists, and developers to enhance our trading infrastructure
Continuously refine and improve trading models using real-time and historical data

¬†

Qualifications

Proficiency in Python and experience in algorithmic trading strategy development
Experience in applying mathematical models to financial or energy markets
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment
Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Physics, Economic, or a related field

¬†

What We Offer

The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing energy trading start-up
A high degree of freedom to shape your role and responsibilities
Professional development and learning opportunities in a cutting-edge environment
A collaborative and innovative workplace where your contributions have a direct impact




If you're passionate about algorithmic trading, and the energy markets, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Research Analyst based in Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Quantify is growing rapidly, and we are now looking for a statistician, biostatistician or a quantitatively strong epidemiologist, economist, or other corresponding degrees, to join our RWE unit in Copenhagen as a Research Analyst, with start immediately (taking into account any applicable notice period).

For this particular position, we are looking for someone with a strong background in statistics and programming (preferably R), through university courses, thesis work and/or additional work experience. Experience with data management and statistical programming within epidemiology, health science, or medical research is highly valued, and we are looking for someone eager to build upon this knowledge to contribute to impactful real-world evidence studies.

To thrive at Quantify as a consultant, you have to be a flexible team player with strong communication skills, and strive to meet the needs of your clients, in addition to believing in our mission to improve health care for patients worldwide.

The Role

Responsibilities

As a Research Analyst, you will be part of a diverse team responsible for the design and execution of various projects within Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR). Examples of day-to-day activities include:


Investigate data availability and quality in different Nordic databases
Participate in the development of study protocols and statistical analysis plans
Access and retrieve real-world data
Develop code for data management and analysis in R or Stata
Perform quality control of statistical code
Prepare study reports and academic publications
Communicate the results to internal or external teams


While independent, solutions-oriented work will be required from the start, you will be supported by experienced team members and mentors who will help guide your work and support your professional development.

Your Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in statistics, epidemiology, economics, engineering, mathematical statistics, biostatistics, or another discipline with strong quantitative focus.
Demonstrated skills, including solid hands-on experience, with statistics, statistical programming and/or data management in Stata or R, is a requirement
A valid and current Danish work permit is mandatory
Driven and curious with an independent, solutions-oriented ‚Äúhands-on‚Äù mentality
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team, on multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) in English is mandatory
Fluency in a Nordic language is a merit
Prior evidence of academic publications is a merit
Previous work experience from consultancy or health care sector is a merit


Quantify's Offer

We are an expert consultancy in health economics and outcomes research with Nordic roots and values. We create evidence to support the value of pharmaceutical products across many disease areas, through three internal business units; Real-world Evidence & Analytics (this position); Modelling, Access & Strategy; Evidence Review & Synthesis. Quantify is proud to work with medical innovators across the globe to improve patient lives.

We provide a workplace where you can develop your skills and knowledge in a fast-paced, high-impact environment. There are many opportunities for leadership, personal growth, and involvement in exciting initiatives. Through your work, you will play a key role in helping patients access life changing medicines in a variety of disease areas.

This position will be based at our Copenhagen office and we offer all staff the opportunity of a hybrid workplace model, where you can mix in-office and remote work to enjoy more autonomy and a better work-life balance.

Application

The deadline for submitting your application is 28th February 2025, but please note that we will be interviewing continuously and that this position might be filled before the end of the application period.

Contact information

If you have any specific questions about the role, please contact Fredrika Juhlin fredrika.juhlin@quantifyresearch.com

Title: Data Analyst, Investment Proposals - Parametric
Place: Frederikssund, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management and investment management services. With offices in more than 41 countries, the Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. For further information about Morgan Stanley, please visit www.morganstanley.com.

About Parametric

Parametric is part of Morgan Stanley Investment Management, the asset management division of Morgan Stanley. We partner with advisors, institutions, and consultants to build portfolios focused on what's important to them and their clients. A leader in custom solutions for more than 30 years, we help investors access efficient market exposures, solve implementation challenges, and design multi-asset portfolios that respond to their evolving needs. We also offer systematic alpha and alternative strategies to complement clients' core holdings.

This role is part of Parametric's hybrid working model, which includes working in the office 3 days a week and choosing to work remotely or in the office the remaining days of the week.

About The Role

The Analyst is responsible for assisting in the support of the Institutional and Wealth Management sales teams with quantitative data for recurring and ad hoc due diligence requests with a particular focus on firm and strategy level information. The Investment Proposal team serves as the hub through which information is compiled and disseminated to both internal and external clients. The position requires collaboration with multiple teams so we are looking for an individual with a positive attitude and high initiative that has demonstrated the ability to work collaboratively. The candidate must be detail oriented and have excellent communication and organizational skills.

Primary Responsibilities May Include


Responsible for supporting/completing monthly, quarterly, annual and ad hoc data compilation for:
Databases (Morningstar, eVestment, etc.)
RFPs/RFIs/DDQs
Strategy-level client reporting
Marketing materials
Utilize FactSet and internal data systems to compile comprehensive quantitative reporting including holdings, characteristics, performance attributions, AUM and personnel stats.
Provide ad hoc analysis and support for Institutional Sales and Wealth Management departments.
Act as a contributing member of the team, participating on projects guided by Sr. analysts, supervisor and/or management
Maintain a sense of curiosity. Foster a positive attitude and look out for continuous/incremental improvements.
Develop a specialized knowledge of all Parametric products and build relationship with internal subject matter experts.
Develop a full working knowledge of the firm's structure, key personnel and organizational policies.
Assume other responsibilities as required.


Job Requirements


4-year degree or equivalent, preferably in a related discipline such as business, finance, or economics.
1-3 years' of related industry/work (inclusive of internships) experience preferred.
Strong math and quantitative skills.
Proficient in Excel including using PivotTables and V-Lookups; proficiency in macro writing or Alteryx/Tableau is a plus.
Intellectually curious.
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle a heavy, deadline-oriented workload.
Ability to successfully navigate simultaneous multi-level projects and tasks in a team environment.
Working knowledge of statistics and equity risk models is a plus.
Familiarity with FactSet, and other investment analysis tools is a plus.


What You Can Expect From Morgan Stanley

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 85 years. At our foundation are five core values ‚Äî putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back ‚Äî that guide our more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. At Morgan Stanley, you‚Äôll find trusted colleagues, committed mentors and a culture that values diverse perspectives, individual intellect and cross-collaboration. We Firm is differentiated by the caliber of our diverse team. While our company culture and commitment to inclusion define our legacy and shape our future, helping to strengthen our business and bring value to clients around the world. Learn more about how we put this commitment to action: morganstanley.com/diversity. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry.

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Salary range for the position: $70,000 - 150,000/Yr. The successful candidate may be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive compensation award. The successful candidate may be eligible to participate in the relevant business unit's incentive compensation plan, which also may include a discretionary bonus component. Morgan Stanley offers a full spectrum of benefits, including Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Dependent Day Care Savings Account, Life Insurance, Disability and Other Insurance Plans, Paid Time Off (including Sick Leave consistent with state and local law, Parental Leave and 20 Vacation Days annually), 10 Paid Holidays, 401(k), and Short/Long Term Disability, in addition to other special perks reserved for our employees. Please visit mybenefits.morganstanley.com to learn more about our benefit offerings.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

Morgan Stanley offers a full spectrum of benefits, including Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Dependent Day Care Savings Account, Life Insurance, Disability and Other Insurance Plans, Paid Time Off (including Sick Leave consistent with state and local law, Parental Leave and 20 Vacation Days annually), 10 Paid Holidays, 401(k), and Short/Long Term Disability, in addition to other special perks reserved for our employees. Please visit mybenefits.morganstanley.com to learn more about our benefit offerings.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The business

Driversnote is a product-centric and profitable SaaS company in the heart of Copenhagen. We proudly help over 3 million users across more than 50 countries log their mileage. No one enjoys the hassle of mileage documentation. We automate and simplify this tedious task, and make our customer‚Äôs work-life easier while saving them both time and money.




We are 35 people working closely together on design, mobile and web development, marketing, support, sales and customer success.




At Driversnote, you will enjoy the benefits of working at a company that has a clear product-market fit and is fully owned and operated by the founder team. We're profitable and have quadrupled our ARR over the last three years. Our scale will allow you to operate in a truly data-driven fashion, and our independence ensures that we always align our decisions with the best interests of our customers and employees.




The product

Driversnote‚Äôs main experience is a highly rated freemium app, to a large extent spread through word of mouth. We offer automatic mileage tracking based on the phone's geo location and in addition, we offer a piece of hardware known as an iBeacon to ensure precision tracking, when you enter your car.




The mobile app is backed by a substantial backend, and at driversnote.com we offer a fully fledged web application with advanced trip management, team management and workflows for teams.




We have a B2C-like relationship with many of our users, but we are gradually moving more and more into traditional B2B space with all that this entails of further product enhancements.




The way we work

We use a product development process known as Shape Up, where a few key people take the role as shapers and define projects that can be designed, implemented and released within 6 weeks, known as cycles. For each 6 week cycle, we form new cross-functional teams with designers, developers, marketeers and customer supporters on them, and we let the teams focus exclusively on finishing their projects within the cycle. Each 6 week cycle is followed by a 2 week cool-down period, where we fix bugs, execute functional projects, evaluate how we did and plan the next cycle.




We like to say that our unfair advantage is that we care more than our competitors, and our users and customers tend to agree when they review our app, respond to NPS surveys and rate our support. We have a generous budget set aside for each employee to learn and develop, and we do a lot of fun stuff together.




The opportunity

We are very data-driven at Driversnote, and with over 3 million users to learn from, that's not just something we say. Data is at the heart of every decision we make, and to us, every change is an experiment and a chance to learn. We use BigQuery as our data warehouse, and use Looker Studio to create reports and dashboards, so it‚Äôs possible to dive right into our data.




Last year we hired our first data analyst fully dedicated to understanding our data and making the most of it. Our increased data capabilities have been a great success, and now we are ready to expand the data analysis team with this additional role and bring even more experience into the company.




The role

As our new Principal Data Analyst, you will report to the CTO and work closely with everyone from senior leaders to product, design, and marketing on maturing the ways we work with and learn from data. As part of your daily life, you will




Own our data warehouse and analytics setup with support from our developers.
Pro-actively identify new opportunities for business growth and improving user experience based on our data.
Service our management team with data and insights supporting strategic decisions.
Take ownership of our experiment setup, assessing hypotheses based on millions of data points.
Drive our build-measure-learn loop by sparring on experiment designs and partner with experiment owners to conclude and learn from results
Support the product, operations and marketing team by having a smooth flow of data and ensuring easy-to-use reporting.
Take a hands-on approach and build, update and customise data sources.
Enable and upskill the data capabilities of everyone in the company to ensure that we can continue to be obsessively data-driven as we scale up.




Based on your previous experience, we expect you to be proactive, continuously optimize the way we work with data and identify new ways to use our data both internally and in our product.




You must:

Have 3+ years of experience analyzing user behavior and funnels inside mobile or web apps.
Have advanced experience with BigQuery or a similar SQL-based data platform, ability to write complex queries from scratch from multiple tables, creating the appropriate joins, extracting and manipulating data, formatting fields, creating new measures and metrics, etc.
Have deep knowledge on business intelligence and data warehousing, and a pulse on data science, data engineering and all aspects of the ETL pipeline.
Understand the typical marketing channels and attribution, especially Google Ads.
Have worked with data from Google Analytics, Firebase or similar platforms.
Have experience with Looker Studio or similar reporting tools.
Be an excellent communicator and data-driven storyteller in spoken as well as written English.
Thrive in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment operating at both strategic and tactical levels with a great attention to detail.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex datasets, and drive business strategy and decision making through partnership across the organization.




We work in English and on-site from our office in Copenhagen with a flexible work from home policy. You will need a Danish work permit for this role.




What we believe in

Vision & mission: We work to eliminate work-life hassles to let people focus on what matters. Today, that means removing the pain and trivial work of handling mileage, while providing peace of mind that nothing is forgotten and all rules are followed.




Product-led: We focus our work on the end-user and optimize for bottom-up adoption. People's use of our product is what leads to our growth. We sell through our product and as self-service. We invest in customer success instead of outbound sales. Our marketing is focused on people with a need, leading them to the product.




Lean & data-driven: We try to get a deep understanding of the problems we‚Äôre solving. But we also acknowledge that we often can‚Äôt predict the outcome of our work. So we believe in an experiment-based approach to product development with short build-measure-learn cycles. For this reason, we also don‚Äôt believe in detailed plans for more than 3 months ahead.




Long-term & compounding: We invest in things with a continuous return and compound. We, e.g., prefer to sell fewer licenses to smaller companies that are a good fit and have a long-term relationship rather than win a ‚Ç¨100k deal with a company that will never actually benefit from our solution. We‚Äôre self-funded, so we don‚Äôt stress about the next funding round and take the time to go into depth with our work.




What we offer

At Driversnote you will be part of an international team composed of talented people that are fun to be around. You will have ample opportunity to influence decisions at all levels, and we hope we can both teach you something and learn something new from you. You‚Äôll get to work with and learn from a team of highly experienced entrepreneurs and tech people. We‚Äôll set aside resources for independent skill development to help you grow and develop your career.




We work in a relaxed environment with new offices near The Meatpacking District. We get a tasty, freshly cooked lunch every day (vegetarian option available), great coffee, cozy Friday drinks, and have great events; from our running club and gaming nights, to our epic Christmas and summer parties.




Since many of us have spouses and kids that we enjoy spending time with, we can honestly say that we offer a healthy work-life balance along with a competitive salary and all the benefits you would expect.




How to apply

Click the button below and complete the application form.




We look forward to hearing from you!




Apply for this position




We accept applications until March 11, 2025. After this, we expect to take a couple of days to review all applications and get back to you no later than March 18. Expect case work during the interview process. The case will be representative of the kind of work you‚Äôll do with us.




For further information or questions, please contact Casper Fabricius at cf@driversnote.com or (+45) 40 50 84 09

Title: Forsker
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
FORSKER MED INTERESSE FOR TV√ÜRSEKTORIELLE SUNDHEDSDATA

Vil du v√¶re med til at oms√¶tte sundhedsdata til konkrete forbedringer for borgere, patienter og sundhedsprofessionelle?

Har du erfaring med registerforskning i det tv√¶rsektorielle sundhedsv√¶sen, og interesserer du dig for implementering af forskningsbaserede kliniske l√∏sninger til gavn for borgere, patienter og sundhedsprofessionelle p√• tv√¶rs af sektorer? S√• er du den forsker, vi s√∏ger i TV√ÜRSPOR.

TV√ÜRSPOR er et regionalt forskningsprojekt, der st√•r p√• et st√¶rkt fundament af tv√¶rsektorielle sundhedsdata, som anvendes i forskellige delprojekter, der alle har til form√•l at optimere det tv√¶rsektorielle sundhedsv√¶sen, fx ved at nedbringe antallet af uhensigtsm√¶ssige indl√¶ggelser, optimere patientforl√∏b og udvikle digitale l√∏sninger. Vi arbejder b√•de med kunstig intelligens og mere klassiske analysemetoder, og s√• er vi st√¶rkt optaget af implementering af resultaterne.

Din prim√¶re opgave er at drive tv√¶rsektoriel forskning med udgangspunkt i registerbaserede analyser samt udbrede og implementere resultaterne. Derudover f√•r du til opgave at underst√∏tte den forskning, der allerede foreg√•r i TV√ÜRSPOR. Din uddannelsesm√¶ssige baggrund er underordnet, men vi forventer, at du har en ph.d., gerne nogle √•rs erfaring og et indg√•ende kendskab til sundhedsdata og sundhedsv√¶senet p√• tv√¶rs af sektorer. Det vigtigste er, at du kommer med en drivkraft og lyst til at g√∏re en forskel igennem din forskning.

Du kan genkende dig selv i nedenst√•ende


Du har st√¶rke kompetencer indenfor registerforskning
Erfaring med at anvende komplekse datas√¶t, avancerede analysev√¶rkt√∏jer og udlede v√¶rdifulde indsigter fra tv√¶rsektorielle sundhedsdata.
Er vant til at stille kvalificerede forskningssp√∏rgsm√•l til data og br√¶nder for at dykke ned i data og finde potentialerne.
Kendskab til datadrevne metoder til forbedring af sundhedsprocesser og patientforl√∏b er et stort plus.
Du er proaktiv og har en resultatorienteret tilgang
Evne til at arbejde selvst√¶ndigt og m√•lrettet med et klart fokus p√• at skabe resultater, der kan implementeres i praksis.
Har indsigt i sundhedsv√¶senets strukturer og udfordringer og drives af at se konkrete resultater i form af forbedrede patientforl√∏b og optimeret ressourceanvendelse i sundhedsv√¶senet.
Du har erfaring med funding og lovgivning
Erfaring med at indhente midler fra b√•de offentlige og private fonde.
Forst√•else for GDPR og andre relevante lovgivninger inden for h√•ndtering af sundhedsdata.
Du er god til at formidle og samarbejde tv√¶rfagligt og tv√¶rsektorielt
Evne til at pr√¶sentere komplekse forskningsresultater p√• en m√•de, som er letforst√•elig for forskellige m√•lgrupper.
Erfaring med projektarbejde, hvor flere akt√∏rer og perspektiver skal spille sammen, fx p√• tv√¶rs af kommunale, regionale og private akt√∏rer.

I TV√ÜRSPOR vil du indg√• i et tv√¶rfagligt team. Du vil have t√¶t samarbejde med andre regionale forskere med interesse for det tv√¶rsektorielle sundhedsv√¶sen samt eksterne samarbejdspartnere. Der vil derudover v√¶re et t√¶t samarbejde med √∏vrige funktioner i regionen, f.eks. de kliniske afdelinger.

Du f√•r h√∏j grad af selvst√¶ndighed i arbejdet, fleksibilitet og udviklingsmuligheder samtidig med, at du kommer til at arbejde i et engageret tv√¶rfagligt team. Vores omgangsform er √•ben og positiv, og baseret p√• tillid til hinandens faglighed og opgavel√∏sning. Vi sparrer med hinanden og byder ind p√• hinandens opgaver, men er afh√¶ngige af, at vi hver is√¶r tager ansvar for at f√∏lge vores opgaver til d√∏rs. TV√ÜRSPORs regionale udgangspunkt betyder, at du kommer til at arbejde t√¶t sammen med andre centrale akt√∏rer p√• forsknings- og innovationsomr√•det.

Dit organisatoriske oph√¶ng og din arbejdsplads vil v√¶re Forskningsenheden p√• Regionshospitalet Horsens. I det omfang arbejdet tillader det, vil der v√¶re mulighed for hjemmearbejdsdage, ligesom der skal p√•regnes ekstern m√∏deaktivitet.

Om l√∏n- og ans√¶ttelsesvilk√•r

L√∏n- og ans√¶ttelsesforhold i henhold til g√¶ldende overenskomst.

Yderligere oplysninger

Yderligere oplysninger vedr. de faglige sp√∏rgsm√•l i stillingen kan f√•s hos leder af Forskningsenheden Marianne Johansson J√∏rgensen, tlf. 2963 4034.

Din ans√∏gning, indeholdende oplysninger om uddannelse og hidtidig erfaring, skal v√¶re i h√¶nde elektronisk senest fredag den 7. marts 2025.

Der forventes at blive afholdt samtaler i uge 12.

Stillingen er som udgangspunkt en fuldtidsstilling.

Da Region Midtjylland l√∏bende gennemf√∏rer besparelser og omorganiseringer, vil medarbejdere i omplacering, der s√∏ger stillingen, have fortrinsret.

Ans√∏g

Title: Game Analytics Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily‚Äôs Garden. Now we‚Äôre on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.

With more than 300 talented individuals, we are a mix of over 40 nationalities and 43% women. We truly appreciate the richness of different experiences and perspectives that Tactilers bring to the game. This is why we foster a lean organisational culture, in which each individual is encouraged to take responsibility, be open and grow in their own way. We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

üöÄ Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are in the search for the Lead Game Analyst.

In this key role, you will be responsible for ensuring that the foundation of our data infrastructure for Lily's Garden game is solid and consistent (from as early on as possible), as well as contributing to a broader vision for our game analytics as a whole. You'll lead a team of game analysts, shape the vision for analytics, provide data-driven insights to senior leadership, and drive initiatives to improve processes and solutions across the company.

So if you have prior experience in data analytics, team leadership, along with a big interest in understanding how games work and what makes them successful, then you might just be our missing piece! üß©

This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! We therefore offer full relocation support to those coming from outside of Denmark. Here‚Äôs what you'll do on the day-to-day:


You will uncover insights, identify challenges and opportunities and develop strategies for improving our games
Enhance our capabilities in detailed game analytics and operational reporting by shaping our data stack and platform
Managing one of our talented Data teams
You will be collaborating closely with the rest of the game team to establish, measure and track key metrics for success
Communicating key insights and findings to cross-functional teams
Keeping an up-to-date knowledge of project KPIs
Stay on top of the current industry trends and best practices, applying them where appropriate to enhance product insights capabilities


What we‚Äôre looking for:


Strong background in leading strategic data projects and mentoring a diverse team of data analysts
You have a proven track record of working in a senior capacity with multiple stakeholders in fast paced environments.
You have a strong background in data analytics and a good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and effectively communicate findings to all audiences to drive informed product decisions.
Strong technical skills, with proficiency in SQL and Python or other scripting languages
Experience with large data sets and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:


Experience with casual mobile games and an understanding of today‚Äôs casual mobile games market


What‚Äôs in it for you?

üåÜ Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

ü©∫ Pension and private health insurance

üíª A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

üìö Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

üåÆ Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

ü•≥ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

‚úàÔ∏è Relocation package if you are coming from outside of Denmark

üîç Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: ‚òï Introductory chat with your recruiter to make sure we‚Äôre aligned on the scope of the role and your skillset and to provide more context for you. ü§ù Chat with a Data analytics leadership member. üß™ A test assignment, to see your skills in action. ü§ù In this final step, you‚Äôll be meeting with the team to present your test solutions and discuss the more technical aspects of the role.

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.‚Äç

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! üëã
