Title: Performance Management Analyst
Place: Roskilde, Region Zealand, Denmark
Description:
Analyst with Performance Management¬†

DNA




Turn data in to actionable insights and help Executive Management and the organization grow the business




DLF is a global leader within forage and turf seeds, situated in Denmark, Roskilde (soon in a new Headquarter in Sm√∏rum) with roughly 2,000 employees across more than 20 countries, serving customers in 100 countries. We are on an exciting journey as our Executive Management has set ambitious targets for the global company over the next 3 years under our newly formed Group Strategy ‚ÄúConnecting to Grow‚Äù.

¬†

We are looking for talent to come and help us!

Do you want to be the ‚Äômissing link‚Äô in our Business Finance team with focus on Performance Management, so we grow the business, both organically and through acquisitions?

Performance Management, was created in the beginning of 2024 as part of a newly formed Business Finance function ‚Äì build to improve business focus, standardization and scalability. Our main purpose is to drive the business dialogue by creating transparency and fuel fact-based decision making for Executive Management, Commercial & Financial leadership and the Board of Directors.

¬†

You will work with Performance Management, converting data in to actionable insights

Your focus will be on developing the needed tools and processes, that can facilitate both existing dialogues and generate new ones. Your main tools will be Excel, PowerPoint (& Thinkcell) and PowerBI and your responsibilities can fall within any of the below areas

Develop, build and maintain analytical tools¬†to create and improve transparency on relevant performance metrics for management in Executive leadership and SBUs, that allows for leaders to quickly understand and act on relevant business insights
Drive the monthly reviews as well as Forecast reviews¬†and facilitate the process with relevant tools & packages for CEO and CFO to fuel professional, fact-based and relevant business discussions
Develop high-quality presentations for EMB and BoD¬†to ensure the best possible dialogue and clarity around business-critical discussions and actions
Support Senior leadership with relevant ad-hoc analysis¬†and insights to help understand the business and potential challenges




We are a small team who drive this agenda and we are looking for a Performance Management Analyst who wants to work within the sphere of Performance Management and help DLF navigate to grow the business.

¬†

This is you!

We are looking for an engaged, bright and eager graduate who is at the beginning of their career. You see the DLF journey as an exciting career opportunity and want to improve your skills within the field of performance management. Your attitude to contribute to our purpose and your fit with the team and the rest of Business Finance is what we care about the most!

Other than that, If you can check most of the boxes off below we would really like to hear from you!

‚ÄòPerformance management‚Äô, ‚Äònumbers‚Äô, ‚ÄòExcel‚Äô, ‚ÄòPowerBI‚Äô and ‚ÄòFinancial/commercial analysis‚Äô are all key words that you want to work with!
You bring an engaged and friendly attitude to work ‚Äì and you want to learn and contribute
You have a relevant degree within Economics or equivalent preferably with 1-2 years of relevant experience
You have experience working with financial tools in Excel and/or PowerBI as well as the underlying data models
You are open to a blend of new as well as operational tasks
You think DLF sounds like a great place to work, and can see yourself here long-term

You speak English fluently (Corporate Finance includes nationalities from around the world and Danish is not a prerequisite)

¬†

This is us!

Performance Management is a new and young team and together with Business Finance we are 7 in total, consisting of diverse backgrounds both with long-time experience in DLF as well as new hires. Common to us all, is that we appreciate a fun and relaxed atmosphere though with an unwavering focus on being ambitious about the value we create for the business. As a member of the team we can offer you:




An exciting workplace where we will support your growth¬†and develop your skills based on where you are. We are looking for an analyst, but want to hire for a career.
Balance and flexibility. It is equally important for us to be ambitious and deliver what we¬†promise as it is to ensure we have fun on the way and can enjoy our private lives. We all appreciate to be together at the office but equally support the option to work from home when it is needed.
Immediate contribution and exposure¬†‚Äì As a small team with an array of different potential tasks you will get immediate responsibility serving key stakeholder groups including the Group CEO and CFO as well as Executive Management, the Board of Directors and other senior leadership. The tools and insight you provide will bring value at a high level and contribute to drive the business dialogue forward.
A brand-new Headquarter in Sm√∏rum¬†is currently under construction and will be ready in late 2025 where we will move in to state-of-the-art facilities.¬†




Are you intrigued? Are you ready to take your career to the next level?

Then upload us a motivated CV, and tell us why you‚Äôre the right candidate for the role. We aim to conduct the first interviews during week 9-10 so do not hesitate to make your submission. We look forward to hear from you and welcoming you to DLF and our team!




If you have questions do not hesitate to reach out to Head of Performance Management, Lasse Severin Hansen +45 2082 4787. If you want to learn more about DLF check out¬†www.dlf.com

HTML:
Analyst with Performance Management 

DNA


  • Turn data in to actionable insights and help Executive Management and the organization grow the business


DLF is a global leader within forage and turf seeds, situated in Denmark, Roskilde (soon in a new Headquarter in Sm√∏rum) with roughly 2,000 employees across more than 20 countries, serving customers in 100 countries. We are on an exciting journey as our Executive Management has set ambitious targets for the global company over the next 3 years under our newly formed Group Strategy ‚ÄúConnecting to Grow‚Äù.

 

We are looking for talent to come and help us!

Do you want to be the ‚Äômissing link‚Äô in our Business Finance team with focus on Performance Management, so we grow the business, both organically and through acquisitions?

Performance Management, was created in the beginning of 2024 as part of a newly formed Business Finance function ‚Äì build to improve business focus, standardization and scalability. Our main purpose is to drive the business dialogue by creating transparency and fuel fact-based decision making for Executive Management, Commercial & Financial leadership and the Board of Directors.

 

You will work with Performance Management, converting data in to actionable insights

Your focus will be on developing the needed tools and processes, that can facilitate both existing dialogues and generate new ones. Your main tools will be Excel, PowerPoint (& Thinkcell) and PowerBI and your responsibilities can fall within any of the below areas

  • Develop, build and maintain analytical tools to create and improve transparency on relevant performance metrics for management in Executive leadership and SBUs, that allows for leaders to quickly understand and act on relevant business insights
  • Drive the monthly reviews as well as Forecast reviews and facilitate the process with relevant tools & packages for CEO and CFO to fuel professional, fact-based and relevant business discussions
  • Develop high-quality presentations for EMB and BoD to ensure the best possible dialogue and clarity around business-critical discussions and actions
  • Support Senior leadership with relevant ad-hoc analysis and insights to help understand the business and potential challenges


We are a small team who drive this agenda and we are looking for a Performance Management Analyst who wants to work within the sphere of Performance Management and help DLF navigate to grow the business.

 

This is you!

We are looking for an engaged, bright and eager graduate who is at the beginning of their career. You see the DLF journey as an exciting career opportunity and want to improve your skills within the field of performance management. Your attitude to contribute to our purpose and your fit with the team and the rest of Business Finance is what we care about the most!

Other than that, If you can check most of the boxes off below we would really like to hear from you!

  • ‚ÄòPerformance management‚Äô, ‚Äònumbers‚Äô, ‚ÄòExcel‚Äô, ‚ÄòPowerBI‚Äô and ‚ÄòFinancial/commercial analysis‚Äô are all key words that you want to work with!
  • You bring an engaged and friendly attitude to work ‚Äì and you want to learn and contribute
  • You have a relevant degree within Economics or equivalent preferably with 1-2 years of relevant experience
  • You have experience working with financial tools in Excel and/or PowerBI as well as the underlying data models
  • You are open to a blend of new as well as operational tasks
  • You think DLF sounds like a great place to work, and can see yourself here long-term

You speak English fluently (Corporate Finance includes nationalities from around the world and Danish is not a prerequisite)

 

This is us!

Performance Management is a new and young team and together with Business Finance we are 7 in total, consisting of diverse backgrounds both with long-time experience in DLF as well as new hires. Common to us all, is that we appreciate a fun and relaxed atmosphere though with an unwavering focus on being ambitious about the value we create for the business. As a member of the team we can offer you:


  • An exciting workplace where we will support your growth and develop your skills based on where you are. We are looking for an analyst, but want to hire for a career.
  • Balance and flexibility. It is equally important for us to be ambitious and deliver what we promise as it is to ensure we have fun on the way and can enjoy our private lives. We all appreciate to be together at the office but equally support the option to work from home when it is needed.
  • Immediate contribution and exposure ‚Äì As a small team with an array of different potential tasks you will get immediate responsibility serving key stakeholder groups including the Group CEO and CFO as well as Executive Management, the Board of Directors and other senior leadership. The tools and insight you provide will bring value at a high level and contribute to drive the business dialogue forward.
  • A brand-new Headquarter in Sm√∏rum is currently under construction and will be ready in late 2025 where we will move in to state-of-the-art facilities. 


Are you intrigued? Are you ready to take your career to the next level?

Then upload us a motivated CV, and tell us why you‚Äôre the right candidate for the role. We aim to conduct the first interviews during week 9-10 so do not hesitate to make your submission. We look forward to hear from you and welcoming you to DLF and our team!


If you have questions do not hesitate to reach out to Head of Performance Management, Lasse Severin Hansen +45 2082 4787. If you want to learn more about DLF check out www.dlf.com

Title: Data Analyst
Place: London Area, United Kingdom
Description:
Our client is a global leader in premium lifestyle products, specializing in apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. The Global Customer Insights & Experience (CIX) team is seeking a motivated data analyst to support the integration and analysis of large customer data sets, focusing on understanding customer behaviour and interactions with global brands and labels.

Responsibilities:




Utilising the data extracted from data science teams and drawing out customer insights relating to different labels and brands.
Design and build data extracts, manipulations, and summarisations to address customer data questions.
Apply the best technical methodologies and approaches for analysing large data sets on SQL and Tableau.
Collaborate with various teams to deliver clear, actionable insights for global brands and labels.

Requirements:




2-3 years of data analyst experience, ideally from a consulting background.
Experience with large transactional and behavioural data sources.
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Dataiku, and Microsoft Office.
Strong communication skills with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Details:




Start date: ASAP
Location: Hybrid, 2 days per week in the London office
Salary: circa. ¬£55k FTC
Duration: 12 months

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Woking, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Data Analyst

Woking - Hybrid Working

¬£35,000-¬£40,000




I‚Äôm currently working for a global Sales and Marketing expert in Woking who have been going for over 90 years and employs over 30,000 staff meaning they are a market leader in what they do with many years of expertise and industry knowledge behind them. They specialise in many industries but are best known for their exploits in Retail where they support across a variety of areas including data/insights, consultancy, head office services and marketing.




They are looking for a Data Analyst who can work on a variety of accounts throughout the business and provide commercial & analytical data to help spearhead future business decisions and investments. Many of these will be household accounts so we are looking for someone who has good analytical skills, stakeholder management, a good communicator who can work with the clients to present business cases and has experience with Power BI, PowerPoint and advanced Excel.




You will produce reports all based around current performance, growth opportunities, ROI, location insight, POS compliance and competitor performance. You‚Äôll then present back to the Client or account manager via PowerPoint & Excel.




For this role, the successful candidate would be expected to come into their Woking offices 3 days a week.




Role Requirements

Minimum 1-2 previous years‚Äô experience as a Data Analyst.
Responsibilities include Data Cleaning, Analysis, Visualization and Reporting.
Ideally have worked across variety of accounts ‚Äì large, small, different industries.
Excellent stakeholder management skills and confident presenting to clients.
Able to collaborate with different teams within the business.
Good PowerPoint & Excel skills. Ideally have worked with PowerBI.




Salary/Benefits

¬£35,000-¬£40,000.
26 Days Holiday.
Bonus Scheme.
4% Pension rising to 10%.
Life Assurance x4 base salary.
Health Cash Plan.
Private Medical Insurance through BUPA.
Enhanced Maternity/Paternity scheme.




If this role is of interest, then please apply and I can give you a call.




Tim Stock

01189028800 / 07980610737

https://www.linkedin.com/in/tim-stock-160177159/

Title: Insights Analyst
Place: Sale, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Insight Analyst üìç Location: South Manchester (Hybrid ‚Äì 2 days a week) üí∞ Salary: ¬£35,000-¬£45,000




Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for turning insights into strategic business decisions? We‚Äôre looking for an Insight Analyst to join our client‚Äôs dynamic team and help drive data-led decision-making across the business.




About the Company

Our client are a fast-growing, customer-focused utilities provider supporting businesses across the UK. With a strong commitment to innovation and efficiency, they deliver essential services, including energy, water, and telecoms, ensuring customers receive the best value and support.




The Role

As an Insight Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analysing customer behaviour, market trends, and operational performance. Your insights will directly shape our client‚Äôs business strategy, optimise processes, and enhance customer experience.




Key Responsibilities:

‚úîÔ∏è Analyse large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.

‚úîÔ∏è Develop dashboards and reports to support decision-making across multiple departments.

‚úîÔ∏è Provide actionable insights to improve customer retention, acquisition, and engagement.

‚úîÔ∏è Collaborate with teams across marketing, finance, and operations to drive performance improvements.

‚úîÔ∏è Present complex data findings in a clear and compelling manner to stakeholders.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

‚úÖ Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL & Python

‚úÖ Experience working with business intelligence platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).

‚úÖ Ability to translate data into meaningful insights that drive strategic decisions.

‚úÖ Excellent communication skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels.
